text: We're close on a maze of metal rods, tubes, and wires. It as we pull out that we realize it's the engine of a car. the image we hear a voice talking on a phone.

...hundred thousand streets in this city, you don't need to know the route. You give me a time and place, I give you a five minute window. Those five minutes I'm yours. Whatever goes down I'm yours. Minute either side you're on your own... As the engine ignites and roars to life we DISSOLVE TO:
A map of downtown L.A. spread out on a bed, dozens of dif routes marked in pencil. The voice continues -

...One last thing. You won't be able to reach me at this number again... DRIVER hangs up the phone. He folds his map of LA and sli in his duffel bag. A few clothes and other essentials are packed inside. He zips the bag shut and takes one last lo cheap TV set. On screen, a movie is playing. On a radio, Clippers are taking a pounding from the New York Knicks.

Driver strides through a dimly lit car park, carrying his bag. A YOUNG COUPLE emerge from their car after a late ni out. Driver lowers his eyes, avoiding their gaze as he ma way towards a sleek 1970's Chevelle

The Clippers-Knicks game plays on the car radio now. Driv only half listening, focused on the road. We see his face passing neon lights. Feline good looks. Impassive blue ey Something almost melancholy in his unwavering gaze. He dr carefully, letting other cars overtake.
Driver glides into the parking lot of another low-rent ap block. 2 9/24/10

location: UNDERGROUND CAR PARK/ APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Clutching his duffel bag Driver heads towards the car par elevator. Hurrying out in the opposite direction he sees pretty GIRL in her 20's wearing a waitress outfit. Their meet briefly, before Driver walks on.

Driver heads down the hallway and unlocks the door to his apartment. It's not all that different from his last one. sparse, and anonymous. He doesn't even bother to walk in. tosses his duffel bag inside and locks the door again.

Driver's back on the road, the basketball game still play the radio. He drives past a row of brightly lit Mexican f shacks on Silver Lake Boulevard and turns into a run down lit up with a neon sign - Shannon's Picture Car Warehouse vintage cars.
SHANNON, the owner of the garage, has a distinctive limp. follows him past rows of vintage cars.
...Plain Jane cheap like you asked for but with a hundred and sixty horsepower inside. You get any sleep?
Not this week. As Shannon grins we feel the familiarity between them.
I can offer you some Halcyon.
Won't work. They head past more cars -- Fords, Dodges, Buicks -- unti arrive at a plain looking Impala.
There she is. Silver Impala. Most popular car in the state of California... Driver casts his eyes over the unimpressive vehicle then out his hand for the keys. 3 9/24/10

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. SILVER IMPALA/ TOY DISTRICT/ DOWNTOWN L.A. -

text: The basketball game is approaching the end of the third q Driver's behind the wheel of the Impala now, cruising pas of dingy toy stores on 3rd Street. He glances at his watc 9:50. He checks his mirror then turns into a side street.

A vast electronics superstore dominates the deserted stre Under the pale yellow glow of the street lamps, Driver se signs advertising a `huge blow out weekend sale'. He pull making sure he has a good view of the entrance. On the ra the basketball commentator is getting more excited. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...This is some comeback from the Clippers! Only a few minutes ago they looked dead and buried!... Driver reaches under the seat and pulls out a small handh scanner. He switches it on, tuning it to the right freque Crackling police dispatches are interspersed with the bas commentary now. POLICE SCANNER
...9 Adam 81, what is your current location?...Repeat, what is your current location?... BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Another unbelievable three pointer from Davis and the Clippers are within five!... Out of the corner of his eye Driver sees two MEN approach doesn't react, expecting them. They cut through the fence bolt cutters and approach the main building. Driver watch pull on their masks, then one of them takes out a shotgun blasts the lock to the front door. Instantly the alarm sh The only thing Driver does is to turn on his stop watch. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Time out Knicks... The stop watching keeps ticking away, the siren blaring, commentary continuing, the police scanner crackling. The storefront is hidden in shadow, impossible to tell wh going on inside. Driver looks at his stop watch. Almost t minutes. One of the masked men emerges now, carrying a du bag. He hurries over and gets in the back of Driver's car without a word. There's no sign of the other robber. (CONTINUED) 4 9/24/10 11 CONTINUED: 11

The commentary continues, so does the crackling on the po scanner. Four minutes. Still no sign of the second armed His companion in the back starts to look nervous, wonderi what's happened to his partner. Driver doesn't betray a hint of nerves. Four and half min his stop watch. Thirty seconds more and he's on his way. Suddenly the second robber appears from the shadows, runn fast as he can to the getaway car. He jumps into the back few seconds short of five minutes and Driver screeches of

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. SILVER IMPALA/ STREETS/ DOWNTOWN

text: Driver thunders over the 1st Street bridge towards Boyle Heights, then eases his foot off the gas, slowing to a st speed. In the back seat the two armed robbers rip off the masks, looking pumped up with adrenalin. Driver studies t his rear view mirror, then swerves right on Mission Stree his police scanner crackles to life. POLICE SCANNER

...Attention all units...211...Superstore on Traction Avenue...Suspects headed Eastbound on 1st Street...Driving a Silver Impala... Driver swings sharply into 4th Street now, crossing the L River again, heading back in the same direction he came. POLICE SCANNER

...Airships dispatched...Downtown and Boyle Heights...All units standby. Repeat, all units standby... Up ahead, the lights of Downtown L.A. glitter against the sky. Hovering between the neon green glow of the skyscrap Driver sees the red and white glint of a police helicopte switches off his headlights, turning left on Santa Fe Ave

The armed robbers watch in tense silence as Driver weaves out of the industrial alleyways with his lights switched It's as if he's trying to find his way out of the maze or probing to see if there's anyone out there. POLICE SCANNER

...1 Baker 11, headed south on Boyle Avenue...No sign of suspects...Repeat, no sign of suspects... The armed robbers look relieved when suddenly a police ca glides past at the end of the alleyway, its lights also o (CONTINUED) 5 9/24/10 13 CONTINUED: 13

It's like catching a glimpse of a passing shark's fin. Dr taps the brakes gently, his car sliding to a stop. He sta there a moment, then eases the Impala forward, turning in same direction as the black-and-white.

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. IMPALA/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA/ DOWNTOWN -

text: It's a high-risk strategy but Driver follows the black-an at a distance, hidden in the darkness, knowing other squa won't be checking the same route. The police car makes it through the dimly lit industrial zone, unaware it's being shadowed. Driver turns his car radio up a whisper. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...And for the first time in the game the Clippers have the lead. 71 to 69. Seven to go in the Fourth here at the Staples Centre... Driver turns the sound back down. Up ahead, the police ca swings left, disappearing from view. Driver slows down to anticipating the next obstacle. He doesn't have long to w the distance he suddenly sees the piercing beam of a poli chopper's search-lights, sweeping the area one more time. Driver floors the gas, speeding straight towards the appr helicopter. The armed robbers are too stunned to protest. just sit there, watching the sweeping searchlights gettin closer and closer. Then suddenly it becomes clear what Driver's doing. Up ah there's a small underpass below the 7th Street bridge. Dr slides the car under the safety of the bridge just before chopper's searchlights spot them.

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. IMPALA/ UNDERPASS/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA -

text: The roar of the helicopter thunders overhead. The underpa crammed with dirty mattresses and shopping carts. Sleepin can be seen under dirty blankets. Driver waits for the ec the helicopter to fade, then moves forward again. 16 INT/EXT. IMPALA/ OLYMPIC BOULEVARD/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. Gloomy yellow street-lamps shine down on the industrial z Rows of delivery trucks are parked outside the meat-packi factories. Driver cruises cautiously down the deserted st The crackling of the police scanner and the droning of th basketball commentary add to the tension. Finally up ahea sees car-lights streaming back and forth on Broadway. DRIVER
Get down... (CONTINUED) 6 9/24/10 16 CONTINUED: 16
The armed robbers lie flat on the back seat, paying Drive respect now.
There's a steady flow of traffic on Broadway. Driver fall behind the other cars. On the radio, the basketball game still playing. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Three thirteen left on the clock. Dunleavy calls a time out and it's the Clippers by one... The passing head-lamps light up Driver's face. There's no trace of emotion in his eyes -- even when he spots a patr approaching in the opposite direction. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Buckle up your seat belts Clippers fans. This game really is too close to call... The two cars pass each other slowly. Driver sees the cops Black-and-White peering at the Impala as they head past. turns down the basketball game and focuses on the scanner POLICE SCANNER

...This is 1 David 16...Silver Impala headed South on Broadway and Pico...Couldn't get a look at her license plates...Appears to be only one occupant... In the back seat, the armed robbers wait nervously for th police dispatch to respond. POLICE SCANNER
...1 David 16...why don't you check her out... As soon as he hears this Driver swerves sharply into the street.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. IMPALA/ SIDESTREET OFF BROADWAY/ DOWNTOWN -

text: Driver guns around the block now, building up speed. POLICE SCANNER
...This is 1 David 16...We lost the suspect somewhere between Broadway and Grand...Possible evasive action...Request airship and additional units... 7 9/24/10

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. IMPALA/ WEST PICO BOULEVARD/ DOWNTOWN

text: Driver bursts out onto Pico now. A squad car headed in th opposite direction slows down as it sees him but is caugh the flow of traffic, unable to turn round and give chase. POLICE SCANNER

...1 David 11...suspect headed West on Pico... Driver threads his way through the vehicles in front of h smooth and effortless it's hard to tell how fast he's goi glances up as he hears the dull rumble of a police choppe overhead. The helicopter is almost directly above him, sw its search-beam back and forth to get a lock on his posit Driver pushes the car as fast as it will go, but there's of outrunning the chopper. Blue light floods the asphalt him as he guns down Figueroa. POLICE SCANNER
All units...pursuit in progress...silver Impala...Headed North on Figueroa... Even now Driver doesn't panic, turning his attention back basketball game. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

Thornton pulls up from behind the arc, misses. Rebound New York. One eighteen to play... Driver swerves sharply towards the sparkling lights of th Staples Centre. 20 INT/EXT. IMPALA/ STAPLES CENTRE/ PARKING LOT - NIGHT. The terraced parking lot looms up ahead. A sign above the barrier says `Season Ticket Holders Only'. Driver punches ticket and roars into the parking lot.
The Impala screeches from one level to the next. With a g going on, the parking lot is almost full. Finally Driver into a free parking space. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Thirty seconds remaining and all the Knicks have to do is run out the clock... Driver glances in his side mirror. Behind him, dozens of are already streaming out into the parking lot before the is over, hoping to avoid the inevitable traffic. (CONTINUED) 8 9/24/10 21 CONTINUED: 21 BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...Gordon back to Davis...Davis for three...This is unbelievable!... The jubilant commentary continues, but Driver isn't liste anymore. The game has served its purpose. More fans flood the parking lot. Dozens of cars pull out of their places. BASKETBALL COMMENTARY

...What a remarkable comeback...Outplayed for most of the game, the Clippers have shown incredible resilience... Driver glances at the armed robbers and nods. It's time. climb out of the car, merging in with the crowd. Driver w them disappear, then slips on a Clippers cap, climbs out Impala himself and heads towards another car.

Outside the parking lot, the police are waiting, stopping anything that looks like an Impala, shining their flashli into the windows. Wearing his Clippers cap and a Clippers sticker on his new car, Driver calmly drives past them, m his getaway. DISSOLVE TO:

location: FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES

text: Driver's face is fixed ahead, sunglasses hiding his eyes. PULL OUT we see to our surprise that he's wearing a polic uniform. It's only as we pull out further that we see sev other `POLICE OFFICERS' sitting in the same fold up chair reading car magazines and scripts as they're powdered by GIRLS, and realize we're on a movie set. Driver glances up from his script and sees another STUNTM being fitted with an SFX mask. The stuntman now looks ide to the STAR of the movie who stands nearby.
I need you guys to sign this contract... Driver takes the form along with all the other stuntmen a signs it without a glance.

location: FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES

text: Shannon is discussing a car stunt with another AD, using cars on the hood of a cop car to demonstrate the danger. (CONTINUED) 9 9/24/10 24 CONTINUED: 24 SHANNON
...This is a whole new thing. He taps the fender any faster than fifty not only will she roll, she'll roll all the way to Baja. Driver heads off, disinterested in the negotiations. SHANNON
A high risk stunt like that's worth at least a thousand five. AD
They won't go higher than a thousand. SHANNON
Done. For all his charm we sense something of the hustler about Shannon.

location: CRAFT TABLE/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES

text: Driver approaches a buffet table laid out with food. He's to help himself when JACK, the caterer, stops him. JACK
Sorry, that's for the director...

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. POLICE CAR/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO

text: Driver sits at the wheel of the Black-and-White while a S SUPERVISOR checks his harness. Shannon leans into the win with a smile. SHANNON
I managed to get them up to five hundred. Driver doesn't seem to care, focussed on the job.
Camera ready, sound ready... Shannon joins the rest of the crew, looking on.

Driver floors the gas, screeching out of the alleyway. He swerves between several oil drums then straightens up on main road. In his rear view mirror he sees a black Dodge Charger app cue, bearing down on him. (CONTINUED) 10 9/24/10 26 CONTINUED: 26

Driver slows to forty, like he's supposed to, but the bla Charger keeps coming at speed. Driver's eyes stay fixed on his rear view mirror, judging other car's speed and angle of approach to perfection. The Charger slams into the back of Driver's car at sixty an hour, hitting him just above the left rear wheel. Driver's reactions are quick as lightning, counter-steeri his Black-and-White goes careening off the road. He keeps car upright long enough to slow it down before it finally end over end. Up ahead, the Charger skids to a showy stop.

...And CUT!... Some clapping and cheering breaks out, but most the crew couldn't care less, returning to their cell-phones and sh lists. Only Shannon seems interested in Driver, limping o helping him out of his battered Black-and-White. SHANNON
Nice work, officer... Driver spits out some fake candyglass from the shattered windscreen.
A New York style pizza-by-the-slice restaurant. A WAITER delivery of Chinese food at the door and carries it over table where Shannon is sitting with an old friend, BERNIE WAITER
Here you go, Mr. Rose. (Taking out the white boxes) Egg rolls, chicken chow mein, five flavor shrimp and Peking duck. BERNIE ROSE
Did they remember the chop sticks? WAITER

Doesn't look like it, sir. Let me run and get the guy. From the way the waiter hurries off we get a sense of Ber power and authority. He turns back to Shannon, resuming t conversation. (CONTINUED) 11 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: 27 BERNIE ROSE
...You run a perfectly good business. Why would you want to change now? SHANNON

You know how much my business made last year? Thirty Grand. Takes me six months to build a car and a couple of seconds for these jerks to write it off on a stunt that doesn't even make it into the movie. Bernie shakes his head but clearly has a soft spot for Sh BERNIE ROSE
How much do you need? SHANNON
Let me talk you through it first. BERNIE ROSE
That sounds like a lot. SHANNON
Doesn't have to be. The big money teams burn through three, four million a year but that's `cause they're using half a dozen test drivers and a stable of cars. BERNIE ROSE
I don't know anything about car racing but I assume there's a reason for that? SHANNON

Sure, but it's not the only way. All I need is a hard-used stock car. We start off with the small-town action then work our way up. There's close to two thousand events out there and once we make the Show we're talking millions. BERNIE ROSE
`Millions'? SHANNON

There's a fortune to be made. Sponsorship. TV deals. We'll even name the team after you. Bernie looks at his friend in mild exasperation then turn as the waiter returns with a handful of chop sticks. BERNIE ROSE
Thank you, Ron. You sure you don't want any of this? (CONTINUED) 12 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: (2) 27 SHANNON
No, thanks. Bernie waits for the waiter to leave then continues. BERNIE ROSE
You still haven't given me a number? Shannon hesitates but only for a second. SHANNON
Four hundred and thirty thousand dollars. Bernie Rose can't help grinning at his nerve. SHANNON
Look, I wouldn't come to you unless I was sure about this. BERNIE ROSE
Come on, Shannon. How can you be sure? What have you got these big money teams don't have? SHANNON
I got a driver. BERNIE ROSE
And they got half a dozen Drivers you told me. SHANNON
Not like this one. He stares at his friend with quiet conviction. SHANNON
I been working with this guy a long time - I've never seen anything like it. I had the money I'd back him myself... Bernie Rose considers him quietly. BERNIE ROSE
But you don't have the money. SHANNON

Everything I own is in metal. I had to sell my Bullit car the other day just to pay the gas bill. I'm telling you, Bernie, put this kid behind a wheel there's nothing he can't do. (CONTINUED) 13 9/24/10 27 CONTINUED: (3) 27 BERNIE ROSE
And what happens to my money if this kid gets hit by a bus? Shannon's about to reply when they're interrupted by a bi of a man with a gruff voice. NINO
What are you doing eating Chink food in my restaurant? BERNIE ROSE
What's a Jew doing running a Pizzeria? Worst fucking pizza in LA by the way. How hard is it to bake a loaf of bread? NINO
It's the fucking water in this city... Shannon smiles, intimidated by Nino, giving up his seat respectfully. Nino doesn't even acknowledge him. BERNIE ROSE
I thought you were supposed to be out of town anyway? NINO
Well, I'm back. (Barely a glance at Shannon) Take a hike. I need to talk to my partner. BERNIE ROSE
Be polite, Nino. I invited him here. NINO
Oh, I'm sorry. How you doing, Shannon? How's the fucking leg? Bernie senses things are only going to get worse and dism Shannon gently. BERNIE ROSE
I'll think about it but I want to meet your guy first...

Driver stands in the elevator as it climbs slowly. It rea the ground floor then the doors slide open. Driver finds face to face with the pretty girl he saw the other night. looks a little startled to see him, then recovers
Hi... (CONTINUED) 14 9/24/10 28 CONTINUED: 28
She joins him in the elevator, carrying a grocery bag wit milk and Fruit Loops cereal. DRIVER
Which floor, ma'am?... IRENE

Fourth please... Driver presses the fourth floor button even though it's a lit. The doors shut and the elevator starts to climb. Dri stares out quietly. Irene takes a glance at him, feeling in the silence. She looks relieved as the elevator doors open. Driver steps aside to let her out first. IRENE
Thank you...
Driver and Irene walk down the corridor in the same direc only a few feet apart. She seems more aware of his presen he is of hers. She reaches the door to her apartment firs IRENE
Goodbye... DRIVER
Goodbye, ma'am... Driver looks at her just long enough not to seem impolite continues down the corridor, not even glancing back.

Bright sunlight. In the distance we see a trail of dust m across the flatland. Everything is silent, then slowly th of an engine rises as the stock car turns towards us. It shimmers in the heat waves, the noise of its engine getti louder as it picks up speed. Shannon stands with his friend Bernie Rose at the edge of makeshift track, staring at the glittering car with its c signage advertising everything from Snickers to Cheerios. BERNIE ROSE
Looks like a chocolate bar. You're gonna have to tell me if that's fast or slow `cause I got no idea... Shannon smiles to himself. SHANNON
It ain't slow... 15 9/24/10

Even in the cramped space of the roll cage there's someth effortless about the way Driver controls the car. His eye fixed in concentration, his body tensing only slightly as lifts his foot off the gas and turns the wheel.

The glinting vehicle is lost in a cloud of dust, then rea again, moving even faster now. The STOCK CAR'S OWNER, a b hot-rodder with a t-shirt that says, "Drive it like you s it", joins Shannon with a confident smile.
Told you she was a beauty... SHANNON
(Playing hard to get) Maybe where you come from... Bernie Rose pays no attention to their banter, his eyes f thoughtfully on the stock car as it finally slows to a st
Driver climbs out of the car. As he looks up he sees Shan limping over with the stock car's owner, a couple of MECH and Bernie Rose. SHANNON
Looks a little long in the tooth to me. Think we should take her home?... Driver shrugs. Shannon grins, turning to Bernie now. SHANNON
Bernie, this is the driver I been telling you about... One look at Bernie Rose and Driver senses the power and authority behind his deceptively gentle eyes. SHANNON
Bernie's thinking of investing in our race team... The old mobster holds out his hand, meeting Driver's gaze DRIVER
My hands are a little dirty. BERNIE ROSE
Don't worry. So are mine... (CONTINUED) 16 9/24/10 33 CONTINUED: 33
He gives Driver a big grin and a warm handshake, sizing h Driver smiles politely, gazing back at him. The stock car owner interrupts the moment between them, holding a stopw
Couldn't see much wrong with that. You beat the fastest lap by more than half a second. DRIVER
You might wanna take a look at the suspension before we go again. (Turning back to Bernie) Nice to meet you... Bernie's still studying him. BERNIE ROSE

You too... Their eyes stay on each other, then Driver follows the st owner and his mechanics back to the car. Bernie Rose star after him quietly, thinking to himself. Shannon can feel getting interested. SHANNON
You gonna give me the four? BERNIE ROSE
I'll give you three for seventy percent...

Tinny supermarket music plays in the background. Driver w past the vast selection of instant coffee brands, bemused choice. Suddenly he notices something out of the corner o eye. At the far end of the aisle his pretty neighbor, Ire browsing through the confectionery section. Standing next is a young boy of six or seven, (BENICIO). He grabs a mul of snickers and puts it in Irene's shopping basket. Irene picks it out, replaces it on the shelf, and takes a singl snicker bar for him instead. As Driver watches them, the turns around and notices him. Driver heads down another a before Irene sees him too, keeping to himself to himself.

Driver heads out of the supermarket with a small bag of groceries when he spots Irene and Benicio again in the ca Irene sits in a battered Oldsmobile, trying to start the She tries several times then gets out in frustration, ope the hood and peering at the engine she has no idea how to Benicio peers in too, trying to be helpful. (CONTINUED) 17 9/24/10 35 CONTINUED: 35

Driver hesitates, all his instincts telling him to contin his car and drive away, but as he feels Irene's increasin frustration he can't help himself, finally heading over t Irene looks over and sees him coming, surprised at first, smiling. We watch from a distance as they talk now. 35a INT. ELEVATOR/ APARTMENT BLOCK/ ECHO PARK - DAY. 35a Driver, Irene and Benicio stand in silence in the elevato Driver clutching some of Irene's grocery bags.
Driver carries Irene's grocery bags into the kitchen for DRIVER
Where do you want me to put them? IRENE
Just over there. Thanks... Driver places the bags on the kitchen counter. IRENE
Would you like something to drink? DRIVER
I'm okay. IRENE
A glass of water? DRIVER
Sure... She pours him a glass of water and hands it to him. IRENE

Excuse me a second... She walks out of the room, leaving Driver alone with Beni The little boy stares at him fixedly. 36a INT. BATHROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 36a Irene closes the bathroom door behind her, looking at her the mirror, feeling a little uncertain.
Benicio's still staring at Driver. Feeling a little awkwa Driver takes a long piece of string from his pocket, tugs gently, then holds up two pieces of string. (CONTINUED) 18 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: 37
Benicio keeps staring at him, puzzled by the magic trick. walks back into the room, smiling. IRENE
You just move to LA? DRIVER
No, I been here a while. IRENE
And before that? DRIVER
Here and there... IRENE

(A gentle smile) Too many questions, huh?... Driver smiles back awkwardly, not sure how else to respon Irene switches on the TV for Benicio, sitting him down on couch. Driver has a sip of water, glancing around the room. He n a few photographs on a side table. Most of them are of Be and Irene, but one of them shows the little boy standing a strikingly handsome Latino man. Irene turns around and sees him looking at the picture. IRENE
That's Benicio's father. Driver takes in the significance of this, then looks back her. DRIVER
What's he do? IRENE
He's in jail. DRIVER
I'm sorry. IRENE
(Changing the subject) What do you do? Driver hesitates. DRIVER
I drive. (CONTINUED) 19 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: (2) 37 IRENE
Like a limo driver? DRIVER
No, for the movies... IRENE (INCREDULOUSLY)
You mean all those car chases and stuff? He nods, a little embarrassed. IRENE
Isn't that dangerous? He seems thrown by her concern. DRIVER
It's just part-time. Most days I work in a garage. IRENE
Where? DRIVER
Reseda Boulevard. IRENE
You should tell Benicio you're a stunt guy. DRIVER
He interested in that kind of stuff? IRENE
Aren't all little boys? She smiles softly and he realizes she's teasing him.
Mama, I don't like this... Irene takes the remote and changes the channel for him. D watches her quietly, then drains his glass of water. IRENE
Would you like another glass? DRIVER
I should get going... He catches the disappointment in her eyes, but she covers with another good humored smile. (CONTINUED) 20 9/24/10 37 CONTINUED: (3) 37 IRENE
Well, thank you for your help. DRIVER

Thank you for the drink... She takes his empty glass and walks him to the door. 38 EXT/INT. STREET/ DRIVER'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - DAY. Passing traffic roars by on the busy street. Irene and Be are walking home from the bus stop, chatting happily. The like they've just come back from the beach, Irene carryin basket full of towels, Benicio clutching a dusty soccer b Driver watches them from the window of his apartment, blo gently on a cup of coffee.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD

text: The reflection of passing neon rolls down the Camaro's windscreen. Driver's cruising down Hollywood Boulevard, s from the world outside, listening to `Purple Rain'. The H and HIPSTERS have taken over the streets while up above airbrushed movie stars stare down from their lofty billbo

It's early morning and Driver's been driving all night, u to sleep. He heads across the parking lot towards a garis mini-mall. Up ahead a small group of GANGBANGERS are hang with intent. They see him coming and look over intimidati Driver's only reaction is to bunch his car keys in his ha longest key sliding between his second and third fingers weapon. The gangbangers don't see it but the unflinching his eyes unnerves them and they look away, letting him pa

head_text.subj: EXT/ INT. BUFFALO BAR AND GRILL/ LA

text: Jukebox music plays in the bar and grill. Driver sits on own, working his way through a plate of bacon and eggs.
Mind if I cut in?... Driver looks up and sees a burly REDNECK with an unkempt and a wrestler's physique. The redneck slides into the se opposite him. BEARDED REDNECK
You're Shannon's buddy, right? We met last year. You drove me and my brother back from Palm Springs... (CONTINUED) 21 9/24/10 41 CONTINUED: 41
Driver stares into the redneck's coked-up eyes, then look down at his food. BEARDED REDNECK

Next run we hired another wheelman - I spent six months in jail, my brother got himself killed... (He grins through yellowing teeth) He wasn't much, mind you, just family... Driver doesn't seem to hear him. BEARDED REDNECK
Thing is - DRIVER
I'm not interested... Driver looks up quietly, fixing him with his icy gaze. Th Redneck's smile slowly fades. He considers his response f moment, then decides against it, standing up. BEARDED REDNECK
Well, it's good to see you again... Driver carries on eating as if the man didn't exist.
The loud stutter of an unhealthy engine. Shannon sits in second hand race car he bought in Montecito, revving the SHANNON

Sounds like a goddamn M-16... Driver smiles, popping the hood. As Shannon limps out of vehicle he sees a battered Oldsmobile drive into the fore He takes one look at the owner, then runs his hand throug white hair, breaking into a friendly smile. SHANNON
Gorgeous day just got even nicer. How can I help you, ma'am?
I've got a problem with my car.
I can imagine. That thing must be older than I am... Driver turns around in surprise now, recognizing Irene's (CONTINUED) 22 9/24/10 42 CONTINUED: 42 IRENE
Hi... DRIVER
Hi... A mischievous smile lights up Shannon's face as he watche SHANNON
You boys and girls know each other? IRENE
We're neighbors. SHANNON
I see... Driver ignores the sly look in the old man's eyes. SHANNON
So what seems to be the problem, ma'am? IRENE
Either it doesn't start or it stalls. SHANNON
Well, why don't we park her over there and take a look... Driver is still watching Irene quietly. IRENE
I can come back later if you're busy... SHANNON
He's busy, I'm not... Shannon gives Driver another sly look as he takes her car
The Oldsmobile's engine looks like it hasn't been service years. Shannon is bent over the hood. SHANNON
...Just my opinion, but I think you should consider buying a new car... IRENE
(With gentle irony) That would be great... She glances round and sees Benicio standing in the foreco with Driver, watching him work on his own car now. (CONTINUED) 23 9/24/10 43 CONTINUED: 43
Driver's so busy tuning the engine he hardly notices the His lack of interest finally gets a rise out of Benicio. BENICIO
That thing doesn't work. DRIVER
(Without looking round) You think? Benicio watches him sullenly, more intrigued than he lets BENICIO
Drive it. DRIVER
Okay. Get in the car... Benicio considers a moment, then turns and calls out to I BENICIO
Mama, can I go in the car?! Irene looks over in surprise, not sure what to say.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ SILVERLAKE BOULEVARD

text: Driver and Benicio sit in the Chevelle, driving in silenc DRIVER
Your mom said you like movies? BENICIO
Sometimes. DRIVER
Ever see the Terminator? BENICIO
No. DRIVER
Grease? Benicio shakes his head. DRIVER
Wanna see where it was shot?
Shannon's got his tool kit out, examining the Olds. Irene at the forecourt but there's no sign of Driver and her so (CONTINUED) 24 9/24/10 45 CONTINUED: 45 IRENE
How long has he been working for you? SHANNON
Don't worry, ma'am, your son'll be fine. IRENE
I didn't mean it like that... Shannon smiles to himself, sensing her interest in Driver SHANNON

We been together about five years now. He showed up out of the blue one day, no references or nothin', asking me for a job. I offered him half the wages I normally pay and he didn't even blink. Been exploiting him ever since... (HE GRINS)
Only thing he knows is cars...

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ LA RIVER

text: The car roars along the drainage canals. In the passenger Benicio looks tense but exhilarated. The car glides past landscape of abandoned shopping carts, garbage bags, and shredded tires, picking up speed all the time.
Driver's parked the car now in an area of the drainage ca which looks like an oasis. He leans against the vehicle, rock playing on his radio as he watches Benicio climb a t
Benicio is asleep in the back of Driver's car now. Driver giving him and Irene a ride back to their apartment. Iren at Driver, waiting for him to say something, but he keeps eyes fixed on the road.

location: BENICIO'S BEDROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK -

text: Cradling the sleeping Benicio in his arms Driver lays him on his bed. Irene takes off her son's clothes and puts on pyjamas, careful not to wake him. Driver slips out of the uncomfortable with the intimate moment between mother and

location: LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Irene walks out of the bedroom, smiling at Driver gratefu IRENE
Thank you for today. He had a great time... (CONTINUED) 25 9/24/10 50 CONTINUED: 50 DRIVER
I'm glad... He stares back at her in the silence, both of them lookin little uncertain. IRENE
