Don't worry... Their eyes stay on each other, the attraction palpable. D finally breaks the tension, making a tentative move towar door. Irene opens it for him, looking up into his eyes. D knows he could kiss her, wants to, but something inside h him back. Instead he just offers his help. DRIVER

You need a ride anywhere over the weekend I'm not doing much... 50a INT. DENTISTS/ NORTH HOLLYWOOD - DAY. 50a Benicio sits in a dentist's chair, looking nervous. Irene beside him, mimicking his expression, trying to make him
Irene emerges with Benicio from the dentists. The little clutching his mouth, making a show of being in pain. Iren teases him gently as they walk. Driver waits for them in car, watching them quietly.

Soft rock plays on the car radio. Irene sits in the passe seat with a smile. Driver looks at her curiously as he dr no idea why she's grinning. Benicio suddenly leans forwar changes the radio to a different station -- hard rock bla out. Driver lets it go for a moment, then changes it back Benicio responds, until it becomes a game, Irene laughing

The roar of machinery. We see quick shots of Driver's day garage -- fixing cars, taking out some fruit he's left to in his tool box for lunch, working on more engines and fr At the end of the day Driver and Shannon examine the stoc SHANNON
...I still can't believe I bought this piece of shit... (CONTINUED) 26 9/24/10 53 CONTINUED: 53
He grins, looking at Driver. SHANNON
I thought maybe we'd take her for a run Thursday or Friday. DRIVER
I can't make Friday. SHANNON
Yeah? Why's that? DRIVER
I told Irene I'd drive her to Burbank. SHANNON
Irene, huh? (TEASING HIM)
You're seeing quite a lot of the young lady. DRIVER
You're taking a long time to fix her car...

location: LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: On the TV, a Japanese cartoon is playing, a masked hero confronting the villains, the screen flickering from colo black and white. Driver and Benicio sit on the couch, wat the cartoon. From their relaxed body language it's clear time has passed and they know each other a little better. DRIVER
What's happening now? BENICIO
He's telling him if he doesn't leave the earth alone he'll fight him. Irene calls out from her bedroom.
I'm almost ready... Driver looks back at the screen. Werewolves appear now, surrounding the hero. DRIVER
Looks like he's in trouble. BENICIO
He's okay. Just as the fight begins the color on the TV screen flick (CONTINUED) 27 9/24/10 54 CONTINUED: 54 DRIVER
I'm gonna show you another trick... Benicio watches curiously as Driver gets off the couch an kneels beside the TV. DRIVER
This is pretty complicated. You watching? Benicio nods. Driver suddenly gives the TV set a hard sma the interference stops. DRIVER
Think you can remember that?... Benicio grins. Driver smiles back then looks away as he h the phone ring. Irene walks out of her bedroom, dressed i waitress's uniform, and answers it. IRENE

Hello?...Yes?...Yes, this is she... Driver sees the look of surprise on Irene's face as she l to the voice on the other end. The doorbell suddenly ring Irene catches Driver's eye and asks him to open it. He he over, checks the spy-hole, then opens the door. A YOUNG W who's sitting for Benicio walks in, looking at Driver cur
Hi... DRIVER
Hello... BENICIO
Hi Cindy... Irene's friend heads past Driver and scolds Benicio affectionately. IRENE'S FRIEND
It's 8:30. Teeth. Pyjamas. TV off. BENICIO
It's not the TV. It's a DVD... Driver looks back at Irene now. She puts down the phone, a smile but still looking distracted.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ ECHO PARK

text: Irene sits next to Driver in the passenger seat, staring the window at the glittering fountain in Echo Park. (CONTINUED) 28 9/24/10 55 CONTINUED: 55 IRENE
I've never come this way before... DRIVER
It's a short cut... IRENE
The park looks pretty at night... She looks at Driver, watching him quietly, then looks awa again. DRIVER
You okay?... Irene takes a long time to answer, still staring out of t window. IRENE
That was my husband's lawyer on the phone. He's getting an early release... She tries to sound casual. Driver takes the news quietly, though it hits him like a sledgehammer. DRIVER
That's great... IRENE

I'm happy for Benicio... Driver knows she's trying to explain herself but doesn't anything, driving in silence. Up ahead the traffic lights turn red and the car slows to stop. Inside, the silence is unbearable. Irene pauses, then loo Driver. He's even more handsome in the shadowy half-light something achingly lonely and melancholy about his stilln She hesitates, then moves her hand towards his, brushing back of his hand, then slipping her fingers between his. The gesture is tiny but charged with emotion. They both s out in silence, fingers clasped, then Irene gently withdr hand, as if nothing's happened. Outside the lights change to green.
The sound of laughter. A sign over the door says, Welcome Dad. Inside the apartment there's a small party going on. (CONTINUED) 29 9/24/10 56 CONTINUED: 56
Irene's husband, STANDARD, has been released from jail an FRIENDS and FAMILY are here to celebrate. Holding Benicio arms he makes a thank you speech to his guests. STANDARD

...I'm touched and grateful that you're all here today -- even though I know it's probably for the food not me... His self-deprecating humor gets a chorus of laughter and agreement from the guests. Irene is standing next to her Cindy, looking a little uncomfortable. STANDARD
...Anyhow, now that I've completed my MBA in catering from Chino Business School... (MORE LAUGHTER)
Irene, Benicio and I are finally going to get our lives back together... He raises his glass to her. STANDARD

I'd like to thank my wife for being the smartest, most beautiful, most patient and loyal woman I know... More applause. Irene stares back at Standard's handsome f feeling even more uncomfortable. 57 INT. DRIVER'S BEDROOM/ APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - SUNSET. Driver lies on his bed, gazing up at the ceiling, listeni the sound of the party echoing down the corridor.
It's nighttime and the party's getting louder. Standard's phone to someone, trying to hear them over the music. STANDARD
I'm sorry, I can't hear you... He heads into the bedroom to take the call. The voice on other end is accented and unfriendly.
Can you hear me now, you cunt? Standard pauses, looking concerned. STANDARD
Sure. (CONTINUED) 30 9/24/10 58 CONTINUED: 58
You're gonna come see me tomorrow, you understand?... Across the crowded room, Irene is looking for Standard. S him in the bedroom, switching off his phone, and heads ov IRENE
Benicio wants you to put him to bed. STANDARD
Okay. He gives her a warm smile. IRENE
Who was that on the phone? STANDARD
My parole officer. He thinks he may have found me a job.
The noise of the party is finally too much for Driver. He off the bed and slips on his jacket.
Irene is finding the party overwhelming too. She heads ou the corridor to have a cigarette when she sees Driver acr hallway, locking the door to his own apartment. She hesit then calls out. IRENE
Hey... He turns around and sees her standing there with a smile. IRENE
I'm sorry about the noise. I was going to leave a note under your door warning you we were having a party. DRIVER
Don't worry. I won't complain. IRENE
I wish you would. Maybe the cops'd show up and send everybody home. Their eyes stay on each other, the music pounding in the background. (CONTINUED) 31 9/24/10 60 CONTINUED: 60 IRENE
The car works great by the way. Hasn't stalled once. DRIVER
I'm glad. Another awkward silence, so much she wants to say but can IRENE
Listen, if you're hungry we got plenty of FOOD -
Suddenly she turns around as she hears her apartment door Standard stands there with Benicio, holding a bag of tras pauses, then smiles. STANDARD
I thought if we emptied the trash everyone would get the message and go home... He grins at his wife, then looks over at Driver, his smil hiding whatever he feels inside. STANDARD
You're the new neighbor, right? Benicio's told me all about you... Driver seems unsure how to respond. DRIVER
He's a great kid. STANDARD
I can't take any of the credit. He's got a great mother. Standard rests his hand gently on Benicio's head, still s at Driver. STANDARD
He tells me you drive for the movies? DRIVER
Yeah. STANDARD
Must be pretty good? DRIVER
I get by. STANDARD
Not like a nine to five gig, huh?... (CONTINUED) 32 9/24/10 60 CONTINUED: (2) 60
He's still smiling but there's a slight edge to his voice looks uncomfortable. IRENE
You want me to take that? STANDARD
No, we got it. His eyes are still fixed on Driver. STANDARD
You want to come in, join us for a drink? DRIVER
I've got some things to do. STANDARD
At this hour of night? IRENE
Standard, he's busy... Standard doesn't respond, still holding Driver's gaze. STANDARD

Well, if we're still going by the time you're back you know where we are. It's good to meet you... He slips his arm around his son now and continues down th corridor, brushing past Driver on his way to empty the tr Driver looks at Irene, then heads off in the same directi Standard and Benicio to take the elevator. The two men st there in charged silence, one emptying the trash, the oth waiting for the elevator, only Benicio oblivious to the t
Brooding movie stars look down from the billboards. Drive his car now, soft rock playing on the radio.
Standard is helping his son get ready for school, interac with him affectionately. Irene watches them from the door looking thoughtful.
Anonymous streets roll by, Driver's eyes fixed on the roa 33 9/24/10

Standard, Irene and Benicio are having dinner at a Chuck Cheese restaurant. We still sense the distance between St and Irene, but Benicio seems completely unaware of it, ta excitedly as he eats his pizza. Standard reaches out and Irene's hand gently as he listens to his son. 65 OMITTED 65
A noise of hammering and drills. The corporate signage ha scraped off the race car and the seats ripped out. Bernie has bought his partner Nino to the garage to take a look investment. NINO
...We paid three hundred fucking grand for this? BERNIE ROSE

I paid for it. Out of my own pocket. Anyway, that's just the shell. You start with the shell, then you build the frame, then the motor. (Pointing to an engine nearby) I paid three hundred for that. The money goes on the inside not the outside. NINO

Fuck that. If I'm gonna blow three hundred I wanna make sure everyone can see it. Go waste your money on something else... Shannon smiles nervously, worried Nino's going to sabotag deal with Bernie. NINO
(Pointing to a Thunderbird) ...How about that fucking pussy mobile over there. BERNIE ROSE

You buy it. Shannon sell him the car... At the far end of the garage Driver hears them laughing, busy working on his car to pay any attention. Shannon ope door of the Thunderbird and invites Nino to take a seat. SHANNON
Try her out. She's more comfortable than a water bed. (CONTINUED) 34 9/24/10 66 CONTINUED: 66 NINO
I already got a fucking water bed. He sits heavily in the car and starts prodding and pressi the control buttons as if he wants to break them. NINO
What does this fucking thing do? SHANNON
Windshield wipers. NINO

How about this little clit? I don't know whether to fuck it or drive it. Fuck it, I'll drive it... Bernie Rose shakes his head at his partner's foul languag looks away, observing Driver quietly. Driver applies a blow torch to his car, so absorbed in hi he doesn't hear Bernie Rose approach.
How you doing?... Driver hears him and turns off the blow torch, standing u respectfully. Bernie Rose gives him a friendly smile. BERNIE ROSE
So, when's our first race? DRIVER
Soon. BERNIE ROSE
You gonna be ready? There's something gently challenging in his gaze. DRIVER
I hope so... BERNIE ROSE

Cautious man. Like myself. Don't wanna make promises you can't keep... Driver smiles but doesn't respond. Bernie Rose finds him to talk to as everyone else. Across the garage, Nino sits T-Bird with Shannon, still fucking with him. Bernie watch them. BERNIE ROSE
He ever tell you how we met? (CONTINUED) 35 9/24/10 66 CONTINUED: (2) 66
Driver shakes his head. BERNIE ROSE

I did some producing back in the 80's. Interesting pictures. Kind of European. Shannon arranged the cars for us and did all the stunts. I knew he was overcharging me but I loved having him around. His next business venture he tried the same thing with some of Nino's friends they broke his spine. He never had much luck... He's about to continue when they're interrupted by a fami voice.
Hey!... Driver turns around and sees Irene's husband, Standard, h towards him with a confident smile. STANDARD
You got a minute? I want to - BERNIE ROSE
We're talking... Bernie Rose barely raises his voice but it's full of quie menace and authority. Standard pauses, stung, but instinc senses this is someone you don't mess with. STANDARD
I'll wait outside... Bernie Rose watches him leave with a look of contempt, th turns back to Driver with a smile, resuming their convers BERNIE ROSE
The reason I'm telling you this is because he's got a lot invested in you. So do I... Their eyes stay on each other with just a hint of tension BERNIE ROSE
Anything you need just let me know... Driver nods. Bernie Rose studies him a moment, then final walks away.
Driver joins Standard in the forecourt of the garage, the sun blazing down on them. (CONTINUED) 36 9/24/10 67 CONTINUED: 67 STANDARD
Irene told me you'd fixed our car. How much do I owe you? DRIVER
Don't worry about it. STANDARD
I do worry. I like to pay my debts. Driver senses the quiet pride in his voice, and lets it g DRIVER
Call it fifty. Standard counts out some bills from his tattered wallet, eyes lowered. STANDARD
I was thinking of trading her in for a new car. Something fast and cheap. DRIVER
You can't have both. STANDARD
Alright then, fast. Even though he smiles Driver senses just a hint of tensio his handsome face. DRIVER

(Pointing to a car) Something like that Buick over there'll cost you nine grand but there isn't much point in a city where you can't drive faster than sixty five. Standard considers the car a moment, something clearly bo him, then looks back at Driver. STANDARD
You must think I'm an asshole? Driver isn't sure what he's getting at. DRIVER
I wouldn't know. STANDARD
Well, I am. Six months inside for holding somebody else's stolen shit... He smiles ironically, his gaze still fixed on Driver. (CONTINUED) 37 9/24/10 67 CONTINUED: (2) 67 STANDARD

I appreciate what you did for my family when I was away but I don't plan to fuck up a second time... It's a thinly veiled message that he's back and here to s Driver stares back at him when Shannon emerges from the g with Bernie Rose and Nino, calling out. SHANNON
Hey, kid! Come say goodbye, the money people are leaving!... Driver and Standard stare at each other a moment longer t Driver breaks off. DRIVER
Excuse me. STANDARD
See you around... Driver walks off, leaving Standard alone with his thought Shannon watches Standard curiously as Driver approaches. SHANNON
Who was that? DRIVER
Irene's husband. SHANNON (GRINNING)
What did I tell you about married women? Nino can't resist another dig at Shannon. NINO
What the fuck do you know about married women? BERNIE ROSE
Can you for once say something without the word fuck in it? As they continue their banter, Driver glances at Standard walking back to his car, dialling someone on his cell pho

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ MEXICAN RESTAURANT/ DOWNTOWN -

text: Passing traffic blurs past. Through the windows of a Mexi restaurant we see Irene at work, serving tables in her waitress's uniform. (CONTINUED) 38 9/24/10 68 CONTINUED: 68
Driver's parked across the street, watching her from his hesitates, conflicted, then finally gets out of the car.
Irene walks out of the kitchen with a tray of food, then as she sees Driver sitting at a booth. She looks surprise see him, but pleased, serving her table first then headin IRENE
Hi... DRIVER
Hi... Their eyes stay on each other, oblivious to the noise. IRENE
We haven't seen you around in a while. You must have been pretty busy?... DRIVER
You look pretty busy yourself... She smiles, glancing at the tables she's supposed to serv IRENE
What can I get you? DRIVER
I already ate. I just wanted to see how you were? His concern touches her and makes her uncomfortable at th time. IRENE
We're okay. Standard thinks he may have found a job so I can give up my night shift... Driver stares back at her with his intense gaze. IRENE
Benicio misses you... From the way she says it she could almost be talking abou herself. IRENE
He keeps asking me to invite you for dinner... (CONTINUED) 39 9/24/10 69 CONTINUED: 69 DRIVER
I'd like that... His gentle gaze is finally too much for her. She grins, e herself. IRENE
I better serve some food... It's only when she has her back turned that we see how ha is for her. Driver watches her walk away, lost in thought
Irene piles some plates of tacos on her tray, bracing her go back out and face Driver -- but when she finally walks again he's no longer there.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ APARTMENT BLOCK/ ECHO PARK

text: Driver leans out of his car window and inserts a key to o gates of the underground car park. 72 INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ UNDERGROUND CAR PARK - NIGHT. As Driver descends into the darkness of the car park, he group of SHADOWY FIGURES walking in the opposite directio heading up the ramp, one of them being pushed in a wheelc Their leader, a large, balding man, (COOK), glances in Dr direction then looks away. Driver cruises past the mysterious group and winds his wa further down the car park. Suddenly he notices something the shadows. A figure lies sprawled against one of the pi A smaller figure kneels a few feet away. Driver stops his now, climbing out to see what's happened. The prone figure groans in pain. As Driver approaches he realizes it's Standard. His face is covered in blood and clutches his ribs. The smaller figure is Benicio. He star his father helplessly, then looks up at Driver in tears. kneels beside Standard, checking nothing's broken. DRIVER
Can you move? STANDARD
Where's Benicio? DRIVER
He's right here... Driver glances at Benicio. He looks terrified. Standard r his head painfully and looks at his son. (CONTINUED) 40 9/24/10 72 CONTINUED: 72 STANDARD
It's okay, Benicio. I'm okay... Driver watches the boy struggling to hold back his tears. STANDARD (GENTLY)
Don't say anything to your mother, you understand? This is between you and me. Benicio nods, too choked-up to speak. Standard turns to D STANDARD

Can I use your bathroom to clean up? I don't want Irene to come home and see me like this... 73 INT. BATHROOM/ DRIVER'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. Standard is bent over the sink, splashing water on his fa he turns off the tap he notices how neatly Driver's laid toothbrush, shaving cream, and razor. He finally turns ar and looks at Driver. STANDARD
Thanks. Sorry about getting all this blood everywhere... He's still shaken but tries to pass it off with a smile. STANDARD
Fucking punks took me by surprise... Driver watches him, unconvinced. DRIVER
Fucking punks didn't look like they needed to... Standard looks at him in surprise now. STANDARD
You saw them, huh?... Driver doesn't answer, waiting for him to continue. Stand hesitates, still not sure whether to trust him. STANDARD
You ever been inside? DRIVER
Why? (CONTINUED) 41 9/24/10 73 CONTINUED: 73
Standard takes another glance at the items laid out neatl the sink. STANDARD
I owed some protection money in the joint. Driver begins to see how worried he is. DRIVER
How much? STANDARD
They want twenty thousand. I told them I couldn't pay so they want me to do a job for them... DRIVER
Is that why you need a car? Standard stares back at him. STANDARD
What did you say you were inside for? DRIVER
I didn't. A beat, then he finally opens up. STANDARD
It's a pawn shop in the valley. I tried to back out tonight, they said they'd come after Irene and Benicio next time... Driver stares at him in surprise now, more concerned than shows. DRIVER
Why don't you take them away? STANDARD
Where would I go? Irene finds out I fucked up again I'll lose everything... He sounds upset, angry with himself. STANDARD
This lousy job's my only way out... Driver stares at his battered face and the blood stains o shirt, then walks out of the bathroom to check on Benicio 42 9/24/10

location: LIVING ROOM/ DRIVER'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Benicio is watching a baseball game on TV, his back to Dr DRIVER
You okay? The little boy nods without turning round, still frighten his ordeal. DRIVER

You want something to drink? Benicio shakes his head, trying to hide his tears. Driver over, then stops as he notices something in Benicio's han little boy is clutching it as if he's afraid to let go. DRIVER
What have you got there?... Benicio holds out his hand to reveal a small bullet. Driv stares at it, then looks at him. DRIVER
Who gave you that?... BENICIO
One of those men. He told me not to lose it... Driver gazes at the little boy's frightened face in conce his eyes faraway, thinking to himself. 75 OMITTED 75
An outdoor food shack in a park. COOK, the leader of the of men who beat Standard up in the parking lot, sits at a with his girlfriend, BLANCHE, a stunning blonde with shor cropped hair. COOK
I've got you to do this fucking job for me, why do I need to pay someone else? Standard sits next to Driver, holding his ground even tho he's clearly intimidated by the Albanian. STANDARD
I'll pay him out of what's left of my share. I can't do something like this on my own. (CONTINUED) 43 9/24/10 76 CONTINUED: 76 COOK
You got Blanche... He grins, looking at Driver now. Blanche doesn't even see hear them, hung-over from the previous night. COOK
You look like you're hard to work with? DRIVER
Not if we understand each other. COOK
What's to understand? It's my score. Either you sign on or you don't. Driver stares at him quietly, finding it hard to conceal contempt. DRIVER
I drive. That's all I do. Blanche gets up from the table before Cook can respond. COOK
Where are you going? BLANCHE
They've forgotten my Coke. COOK
They'll bring it. Sit down. (His eyes still fixed on Driver) Standard, why don't you hire a fucking taxi cab? STANDARD
He didn't mean it like that, man... Standard looks worried, trying to diffuse the tension. COOK
So, what does he mean? Driver looks him calmly in the eye. DRIVER

You tell me where we start, where we're headed, where we'll be going afterwards. I don't take part, I don't carry weapons, I drive... Standard seems surprised by Driver's professional patter. does Cook. Even Blanche looks interested for once. (CONTINUED) 44 9/24/10 76 CONTINUED: (2) 76 COOK
Standard, get Blanche her coca cola. Standard hesitates, but has no choice. As he leaves to fe Blanche her drink, Cook starts to write something down on palm of his hand. COOK

Okay, here's the deal. This much for Blanche, this much for that asshole minus what he owes me, and this much for you... He holds up the palm of his hand to Driver, the words Fuc written in marker pen. COOK
You still interested? Driver looks at him, all his instincts telling him to wal but he stays where he is, thinking of Irene and Benicio. COOK
Good. Anything else?... Driver stares back at him with his clear blue eyes. DRIVER
We do this job he's paid his debt. You leave him and his family alone... Cook looks surprised at first, then laughs at his nerve. COOK
Whatever you say, boss...
The midday sun beats down on a maze of cars. Driver strol rows of glittering vehicles until he spots an old model M

location: LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Driver sits at the dinner table with Standard, Irene and now. Standard's in high spirits, beaming at his wife. STANDARD

...I was such a jerk the first time we met. We're at this party and I see the most beautiful girl I ever laid eyes on and I walk over and say, `Hello Miss, my name's Standard Guzman'. She takes one look at me and asks, `Where's the deluxe version?'... (HE LAUGHS)
It took me like a minute to get it... (CONTINUED) 45 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: 78
Irene smiles awkwardly, glancing at Driver. Benicio grins to please his dad. STANDARD

You don't get it either do you, Benicio? Hope you didn't inherit your Papa's brains. He ruffles his son's hair then pours himself another shot tequila. Irene notices he's drinking, turning to Driver. IRENE
Would you like some more chicken? DRIVER
Thanks... Their eyes stay on each as she serves him. Standard sees look between them but his only reaction is to drain his g and tuck into his food. STANDARD

Now this is what I call a deluxe chicken. Irene and I are gonna open a restaurant together once I raise the money. That's why she's working in that Mexican joint. Figure out how it's done. She's got more ambition than anyone I know, more smarts too... (He raises his glass) We're gonna drive all those fucking Mexicans out of business - IRENE STANDARD - STANDARD
Excuse my language, Benicio... IRENE
(Changing the subject) How's the movie going?... DRIVER
Fine... Irene looks at Standard as he pours himself another drink IRENE
Don't you think that's enough? STANDARD
Come on, we're celebrating. I've got my family around me and our new friend... (CONTINUED) 46 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: (2) 78
He raises his glass to Driver now. Driver senses how nerv is about the job ahead, and how uncomfortable he is depen someone his wife clearly admires. IRENE
Are you working on anything else? STANDARD
Stop asking the poor guy all these QUESTIONS - IRENE (LOSING PATIENCE)
Then why don't you go ahead and talk for all of us. STANDARD
All right, I will. This time next week I'm gonna take you and Benicio away with me... Irene stops and looks at him in surprise. STANDARD
Where you wanna go, Benicio?... His quiet confidence concerns her even more. BENICIO
Disneyland. STANDARD
Forget Disneyland. I'm gonna take you and your mother away from this bullshit city - IRENE
Benicio, it's time for bed - STANDARD
Your papa's got it all figured out - IRENE
Benicio, you heard me - STANDARD

It's okay. I'll take him... Standard gets up from the table, lifting Benicio up in hi and carrying him back to his bedroom. Driver watches them in this kind of mood Standard's clearly devoted to his so Irene waits until they're gone, then turns back to Driver IRENE
I'm sorry. (CONTINUED) 47 9/24/10 78 CONTINUED: (3) 78 DRIVER
Don't worry... She hesitates, torn, then looks up at him again, needing confide in someone. IRENE

Every time he makes that speech about taking me and Benicio away from here he's in some kind of trouble... Driver sees the deep concern in her eyes and feels even m torn. Irene gets up, clearing away some plates.

location: UNDERGROUND PARKING LOT/ APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Driver strides through the parking lot and climbs in his 80 INT. CAR/ UNDERGROUND PARKING LOT/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. Driver sits in the car as if it's his retreat from the wo stares out, then turns on a stop watch, listening to it t finding his balance again in the familiarity of the ritua

The pawn shop is nothing much to look at from the outside another anonymous LA store front. Driver's parked the car hundred yards from the entrance, his police scanner crack Standard sits beside him in the passenger seat, looking t DRIVER
You don't have to do this. STANDARD

(Forcing a smile) What are you talking about? He tries to make light of it but doesn't sound convincing of his window he sees Blanche cross the street and enter pawn shop and looks even more nervous now. STANDARD
Irene and Benicio think the world of you, you know that, right?... Driver glances at him, sensing his anxiety. STANDARD
Say something happens to me, you think you could find a way to take care of them?... Standard's still staring ahead, but Driver can sense his (CONTINUED) 48 9/24/10 81 CONTINUED: 81 DRIVER
It's not too late... Standard considers a moment, then shakes his head. STANDARD
I gotta do this for them... He forces a smile, slips on his sunglasses, then finally the door. DRIVER
You got five minutes... STANDARD (GRINNING)

I'll see you in four... Driver watches him cross the street with a strong sense o foreboding. Standard enters the pawn shop. Driver starts stopwatch now, listening to the seconds tick away. He casts his eyes around the street, observing the smalle details -- the number plates of other vehicles; the windo overlooking buildings. The white hot sun blazes down, reflecting on the pawn sho windows, hiding everything inside. The police scanner crackles but picks up no activity. Dri listens to his stop watch, in his own world. He starts th engine and sets off, cruising slowly past the pawn shop, for the corner where he told Standard he'd be waiting. He pulls over by the curb when suddenly he notices someth Parked a hundred yards down the road he sees another vehi glinting in the sunlight. To the ordinary eye it's no dif from the other cars parked nearby, but to Driver it stand For one, it's a Chrysler. Secondly, it has reinforced bum and racing tires. Driver's stopwatch shows four minutes now. He looks away the Chrysler, gazing at the doors of the pawn shop, expec Standard and Blanche to burst out at any moment. But there's no sign of them. The seconds tick away. Five minutes. Driver hesitates, al instincts telling him to drive off, but he stays where he thinking of Irene. Suddenly he sees Standard and Blanche emerge from the paw Standard clutching a big black gym bag in his hand. (CONTINUED) 49 9/24/10 81 CONTINUED: (2) 81

He smiles at Driver as he approaches when suddenly he hea crack of gunshots behind him. Driver sees the look of pan his face as he spins around. A GUY IN A SUIT strides out of the pawn shop. Crouching l an expert firing position he squeezes off several shots. force of the bullets sends Standard flying. Driver sees him hit the sidewalk, arterial blood pumping his neck. Blanche screams, grabbing the gym bag and leapi the back seat of the car. Driver hesitates, takes one las at Standard's lifeless body, then hits the gas as more gu crack behind him. As Driver's car roars down the street, the Chrysler sudde comes to life, pulling out of its parking place.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. CAR/ STREET/ TARZANA/ LA

text: Driver glances in his rear-view mirror and sees the Chrys his tail. It doesn't seem to be trying to close the gap, following at a discreet distance. In the back seat, Blanc open the gym bag, then stares in shock. BLANCHE

...Christ, there wasn't supposed to be this much money!... There are literally stacks of hundred dollar bills cramme inside the gym bag. Driver catches her reaction in the mi but his attention is focussed on the Chrysler. Up ahead, intersection, the lights turn red. Driver thinks about ru them, but decides against it, braking sharply. The Chrysl draws up beside him, its windows glinting in the sunlight BLANCHE

Move for Chrissakes!... Driver ignores her, still watching the Chrysler out of th corner of his eye. The lights change to green but Driver move. Nor does the Chrysler. Behind them, other cars star honking their horns. Suddenly Driver roars off, swerving speed. The Chrysler reacts, screeching off in pursuit. Driver floors the gas. On speed and power his vehicle may match for the Chrysler, but in traffic the odds are even. weaves his way past the slower cars, putting obstacles be himself and the Chrysler. The pursuing car matches him mo move, staying on his tail. In the back seat, Blanche looks terrified, buckling herse (CONTINUED) 49A 9/24/10 82 CONTINUED: 82

Driver swerves left then suddenly makes a hard right onto deserted canyon road. The mustang somehow manages to make the same turn. It gets close enough to "pit" Driver, its pressing against the rear corner of Driver's vehicle.  Driver's almost run off the road, but manages to save it regains control of his car. The Mustang pulls out wide to build momentum and smash in him. As it moves in to deliver the knockout blow, Driver pulls the Emergency Brake and spins 180 degrees, causing Mustang to miss and lose control for a brief moment. Now the two cars are nose to nose, barrelling down the ro Driver heading in reverse as fast as he can, the Mustang closing fast. It rams Driver's front bumper. BAM! The two cars separate for an instant. The Mustang guns it, ready to smash into Driver again... Driver clocks an upcoming three way intersection dotted w construction equipment. In a last ditch attempt to evade pursuer he throws a reverse 180, then incredibly keeps go spinning 270 degrees. The Mustang tries to make the same turn, but this time th maneuver is beyond his ability. Driver's suckered him int corner he can't control.  The Mustang crashes into the construction equipment in a sickening crunch of metal on metal. Driver guns the motor and speeds away.  50 9/24/10
Purple neon spills onto the forecourt of a seedy motel.
The black gym bag lies open on a double bed, full to the with stacks of cash. Blanche sits on the bed, looking pal DRIVER
How much did Cook tell you you could expect to net? BLANCHE

Forty Grand... She glances at the bag, staring at how much more money th Driver switches on the cheap TV set with the remote, flic through the news channels. There's no mention of the robb yet. He zips up the bag and heads out. DRIVER
Stay here. Don't answer the door... Blanche nods, too shaken to protest.
Driver hesitates, then dials a number on his cell-phone. answers.
Hello?... Driver hears the tremor in his voice. DRIVER
Benicio?...
Yeah?... DRIVER
Is your mom there?... (CONTINUED) 51 9/24/10 85 CONTINUED: 85
There's an uncomfortable silence. Driver can feel the lit trying to hold it together.

She's talking to the police... 85a INT. IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - DAY. 85a In the living room we can see Irene sitting on the couch male and female POLICE OFFICER, looking dazed, taking in news of Standard's death. INTERCUT
Driver pauses, still on the phone to Benicio. DRIVER
Tell her I'll call later...

A soap opera plays on the TV. Driver walks back into the room. Blanche lies on the bed, looking more relaxed. Driv picks up the remote and flicks through the channels until finally finds a breaking news story on the robbery. There police mug-shot of Standard on screen. TV REPORT

...The armed robber was pronounced dead at the scene. He was identified as Standard Guzman of Echo Park, Los Angeles... Driver listens to the report in silence. Blanche seems up again, confronted with the reality of what's happened. TV REPORT

...Other details are unclear but the owner of the pawn shop told reporters that the robber had no accomplices and that the items he'd taken had been recovered. In other news... Driver switches off the TV, staring at the blank screen i surprise. He turns to Blanche. DRIVER
The guy saw you grab the money and jump in the car -- why didn't he say anything? BLANCHE
I've no idea. DRIVER
Any idea there'd be another car waiting? (CONTINUED) 52 9/24/10 86 CONTINUED: 86
This time she takes a fraction too long to answer. BLANCHE
I already told you everything - Driver suddenly slaps her -- hard. DRIVER
You just got a little kid's father killed. You think I won't hurt you? He raises his hand to slap her again and this time she ta tears welling in her eyes. BLANCHE

...Cook told me another car would hold us up...but he never said anything about this much money or anyone getting killed... Driver stares at her quietly, beginning to put the pieces together in his head. DRIVER
You were gonna rip us off and split the take? She nods guiltily. DRIVER
How long have you known him? BLANCHE
Just a couple months. We were fooling around. I've never been mixed up in anything like this - DRIVER
You know his real name? BLANCHE
He told me it was Chris, but I just called him Cook. DRIVER
You're going to take me to him right now, you understand? She nods, terrified, tears running down her face. BLANCHE
....Can I go wash up?... Driver nods distractedly, his mind racing. Blanche heads the bathroom. (CONTINUED) 53 9/24/10 86 CONTINUED: (2) 86

As she disappears inside Driver notices something on the where she's just been lying. It's her cell phone. Still f open as if she's called someone recently. Driver reaches for the cell phone when he notices the sil of a MAN crossing the curtains. Someone's outside. The do handle of the motel room starts to turn, slowly -- then s there's the roar of a shotgun from the bathroom. Driver reacts in an instant, rushing towards the bathroom He has to barge it open, something obstructing his way.

Driver almost trips over Blanche's sprawled body as he bu through. One quick glance and he knows she's dead - half head blown off. Another quick glance and he sees her kill big burly HITMAN, trying to climb through the same bathro window where he just shot her. Driver moves like lightning, grabbing the man's arms befo can get off another shot and pulling him through the wind hitman lands heavily in a sea of broken glass, cutting hi forehead open, blinded momentarily by the blood in his ey Driver takes his opportunity and slams the man's face bac the glass strewn floor, stunning him for a few more secon they struggle. Crawling away, he grabs the towel rack and the metal bar off the wall. Using it as a spear he impale hitman and grabs his shotgun.

In the bedroom, the 2nd HITMAN finally kicks the door ope Driver bursts through the bathroom door at the same time firing the 1st shooter's shotgun. The force of the blast up the 2nd hitman and flings him against the wall like a doll. The startling explosion of violence is over just as sudde it began. Driver slumps to the floor in exhaustion, his h his arm ripped open by the broken glass. There's blood sp all over the wall. Neon lights from outside flashing on t man's face. But no panicked footsteps or sirens yet. Driver crawls over to the dead hitman and rifles through pockets. All he finds are a set of car keys.
Shannon stands in his office, listening silently on the p looking like he's been punched in the gut. (CONTINUED) 54 9/24/10 89 CONTINUED: 89 SHANNON
Why didn't you tell me?... All he hears is silence on the other end. SHANNON
Well, I guess it's done now... He leans back against a car. SHANNON
How big's the take?...
One million I guess... SHANNON
Jesus... He looks dazed by the thought of so much money. SHANNON
You better bring it over.
I'm hurt. I need a doctor to patch me up... SHANNON
I'll take care of it... 90 OMITTED 90

An underworld doctor, "DOC", a shabbily dressed old man w looks well past his prime takes out a small bottle of sco along with his surgical tools, preparing for Driver's arr Shannon watches him uncertainly then heads downstairs as hears a noise in the garage.
Shannon arrives downstairs to see Driver walking unsteadi towards him in the gloom. Shannon can't help glancing at hands, expecting him to be carrying the bag with the mone there's no sign of it.

location: OFFICE/ SHANNON'S GARAGE/ SILVER LAKE BOULEVARD -

text: Scissoring Driver's blood soaked shirt away Doc examines shards of glass embedded in his arm, then notices the dee running down his back. (CONTINUED) 55 9/24/10 93 CONTINUED: 93 DOC
...Looks like you got more metal inside you than a ten ton truck... (His hand shakes) You'd be better off with a mechanic not a medic... Driver looks up at him warily from Shannon's pull out bed DOC
Relax. Just having my fun with you... Doc picks up his bottle of scotch from among his bowls of Peroxide and Betadine, takes a drink, then offers it to D DOC
Take a hit off that. Chances are you'll need it... Driver shakes his head, closing his eyes. Shannon watches quietly, concerned for him but also curious about the mon SHANNON
What did you do with the cash? DRIVER
It's safe. Shannon hesitates, but can't help himself. SHANNON
You want me to look after it for you? Driver doesn't answer, gritting his teeth as Doc pulls ou largest shard of glass. SHANNON
Just think what we could do with all that DOUGH - DRIVER
Two guys just tried to kill me for it. I want to find out who it belongs to first... Shannon nods, coming back down to earth. SHANNON
This guy Cook got a real name?... DRIVER
Maybe Chris. Probably not... SHANNON
I'll ask Bernie if he's heard of him... (CONTINUED) 56 9/24/10 93 CONTINUED: (2) 93
Driver grimaces again as Doc pulls out another shard of g SHANNON
I wish you'd talked to me first... Driver doesn't reply, his eyes fixed on the ceiling. SHANNON
Lotta guys fall for other mens' wives, but you're the only one I know robs a joint to make it up to the husband...
An elegant apartment full of framed photographs of beauti grandchildren and movie posters from Hollywood's golden a Bernie is in his silk pyjamas, looking like he's just wok BERNIE ROSE
You want some coffee? SHANNON
No, thanks... Shannon looks tense but tries to hide it. From next door can hear the sound of raised voices. Bernie Rose grabs th remote and turns up the volume to drown out his neighbors BERNIE ROSE
They've been going at it ever since they moved in. She's such a nice lady but it's a lousy Shidach. It's a wonder they haven't killed each other... (A BEAT)
So, what's your interest in the Seventh Heaven? Shannon doesn't understand, looking confused. BERNIE ROSE
It's a strip joint on La Cienega. Your friend Cook runs it. Why're you curious about him all of a sudden? Even though they're close, Shannon's wary of giving away much information. SHANNON
A friend of mine owes him some money. I was wondering if you knew him? BERNIE ROSE
Yeah, I know him. He's a crazy Albanian. If I were your friend I'd pay up. (CONTINUED) 57 9/24/10 94 CONTINUED: 94
Bernie Rose pours himself a cup of coffee in the kitchene BERNIE ROSE
You wake me up this early this friend must be a close friend? SHANNON (HESITATING)
Yeah... BERNIE ROSE
How's our car by the way? SHANNON
We're all set for next month. BERNIE ROSE
And our driver? SHANNON
He's doing great. BERNIE ROSE
That's what you should worry about... Shannon smiles back but Bernie senses how distracted he i BERNIE ROSE
You want my advice? Let your friend work it out for himself. Don't take pills for other people's headaches... (HE GRINS)
You got twenty minutes? I need you to run down to the market and get me some milk... 95 OMITTED 95

Sunlight pours through a doorway. Driver heads down some passing some half naked STRIPPERS at the bar. There's a h of CLIENTS watching a pole dance, but otherwise the place empty. Driver turns down a long corridor. A couple of STR emerge from their changing room, surprised to see him, bu puts them at ease with a friendly smile. DRIVER
Cook moved office again? STRIPPER
That one over there... Driver smiles gratefully, then heads towards an office at end of the corridor. He knocks on the door. A voice calls (CONTINUED) 58 9/24/10 96 CONTINUED: 96
It's open... Driver takes a hammer out of his jacket, then starts turn door handle as if he can't get in.

It's open, goddamit!... He hears Cook striding impatiently towards the door now. waits, then suddenly kicks the door open, right in Cook's Before Cook can recover, Driver storms into the office, s him across the shoulder with the hammer. Cook collapses i heap. Driver's about to hit him again, when he sees that left hand is broken and there are cuts and bruises on his Someone's clearly given him a beating since the robbery. DRIVER
Should've figured you for a shill. Who were you fronting for? COOK
Fuck you - Driver smashes the hammer into Cook's right hand now, bre it too. Cook screams. Some of the strippers have gathered door but Driver couldn't care less. DRIVER
Whose money am I holding? COOK
Don't worry. They'll come get it. You don't know who you're fucking with - Driver smashes the hammer into the metal plates supportin Cook's left hand. He screams like a stuck pig. DRIVER
Who's money am I holding? COOK

(Barely able to get the words out) Fuck you... The strippers look stunned and riveted at the same time. bends over Cook and rifles through his pockets. Finally h what he's looking for. Cook's cell phone. He scrolls down call log and finds the same number appearing again and ag 97 OMITTED 97 59 9/24/10
The kitchen is busy, CHEFS taking out hot pizzas from the and slicing them up in takeaway boxes. In the background the phone ringing.
An impeccably dressed MAN IN A TAN SUIT answers the phone TAN SUIT
Hello?...I'm afraid we're closed. Could you call back after twelve...

location: PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD

text: (INTERCUT)
Driver leans against his car, talking on Cook's cell phon DRIVER
I could, but your boss won't be happy when he finds out you've kept him waiting... Tan Suit looks curious now. TAN SUIT
Can I ask what this is about? DRIVER
I have something that belongs to him. TAN SUIT
And that would be? DRIVER
A million dollars... There's a pause on the other line now.
Please hold...

Tan Suit walks into the dining area. A large bull of a ma on his own in the empty restaurant with his back to us. I only when he hears Tan Suit approach and turns around tha realize it's Nino, Bernie's partner.

location: PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD

text: Driver hears a heavy chesty voice come on the line. (CONTINUED) 60 9/24/10 102 CONTINUED: 102
You have something that fucking belongs to me?... The voice is unmistakable. Driver stares quietly. DRIVER
Seems that way... (INTERCUT) NINO
And you're calling me why? You expect me to buy my fucking stuff back from you?... DRIVER
I'm not selling. I give you a time and place, you come collect your stuff... NINO
And what do you get out of it?... DRIVER
Just that. Out of it. You put a muzzle on Cook, forget your zombies at the Motel, forget we ever had this conversation... Nino's thinking to himself, looking more concerned than h sounds. NINO
Your partners happy with that?... DRIVER
I don't have partners... NINO
You discuss this with anyone else? DRIVER
Just you... Nino begins to relax now, still calculating. NINO
You're not very good at this, are you?... DRIVER
This isn't what I do. I'll call again with instructions... Driver switches the cell phone off. 61 9/24/10
Nino hangs up. Behind him we see that Tan Suit is also in room, waiting for his orders.

location: LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

text: Irene is sitting on the couch next to Benicio, talking to gently as he watches TV. IRENE

...I'll be back before you go to bed. How's that sound?... The little boy nods, watching his Japanese cartoon. Irene friend, Cindy, is also there, gazing at them both in symp Irene looks up at her. IRENE
Are you going to be okay? CINDY
We'll be fine... Irene gets up to leave when the buzzer rings. She walks o opens the door then stops in surprise. Driver stands ther DRIVER
You got a minute?... She looks at him in a daze. IRENE
Where have you been?... He stares back at her in silence. IRENE
I tried to reach you. Standard's been - DRIVER
I know... His eyes stay on her, as if he's trying to tell her somet more. She looks confused, staring back at him curiously w small voice interrupts.
Hey... Driver looks over at the little boy. DRIVER
Hey... (CONTINUED) 62 9/24/10 104 CONTINUED: 104
Irene begins to see the guilt in his eyes and slowly it h her. She stares in disbelief, reeling. DRIVER
I'm sorry about your father... Benicio nods. Driver keeps staring at the boy but can't f more words of comfort. Irene watches him, still stunned. looks back at her. IRENE
I can't talk now. I have to go. DRIVER
Can I give you a ride? She stares at him in dismay, close to tears. IRENE
The car's working fine. DRIVER
Then let me walk you down... She wants to say no but can't.
Driver and Irene head down the long corridor in silence. IRENE
(Almost a whisper) Why?... Driver misunderstands, thinking she's talking about Stand DRIVER
He was into one of the prison gangs for a lot of money. He was trying to protect you. IRENE
Great job... She walks faster now, striding towards the elevator. Driv follows her. DRIVER
I still have the money. Whatever you need - She turns around and slaps him hard. IRENE
What are you, a bank? I work for a living. I don't need your widow's pension! (CONTINUED) 63 9/24/10 105 CONTINUED: 105
Her eyes well up with tears, staring at him in anger and frustration. IRENE
Just tell me one thing. How did he talk you into it? DRIVER
He didn't talk me into anything. I've been doing this my whole life. It's what I do... She stares at him in deep disappointment. IRENE
Stupid me... She turns away when the elevator bell rings. The doors op revealing TAN SUIT. Neither Driver or Irene recognizes hi we do. He smiles, pretending to look confused. TAN SUIT
Sorry, I'm supposed to be going down... IRENE
So are we... She steps into the elevator. Driver follows her in. TAN SUIT
Which floor? DRIVER
Parking lot, please... Tan Suit presses the button and the doors slide shut.

Driver and Irene ride down in silence, their eyes fixed o other. Tan Suit watches them quietly, considering a move, Driver glances at him and he smiles, biding his time. The on the panel descend. The elevator bell finally rings as reach the lower level. Tan Suit hesitates, but Driver wai him to go out first. He nods goodnight and heads off into darkness of the parking lot. Driver follows Irene, the tw them heading in the opposite direction.

The overhead lights flicker, the huge underground car par hidden in shadow. Driver walks alongside Irene in silence the distance Tan Suit's footsteps slowly fade. (CONTINUED) 64 9/24/10 107 CONTINUED: 107 DRIVER
I'm leaving. I want you to come with me... Irene can't believe what she's hearing. IRENE
What are you talking about? DRIVER
You and Benicio... She's almost too stunned to speak, walking even faster no IRENE
You're crazy. I don't even know you - DRIVER
You will. Once I straighten out this thing I'm getting out for good. We'll go some place. Anywhere you want. She shakes her head, fighting her feelings for him. IRENE
It doesn't work like that. DRIVER
Why not?... She stops and looks at him. IRENE

Because people like you never get out. And I don't want my son to grow up like that... She holds his gaze with regret. Driver's about to respond suddenly he catches a fleeting movement out of the corner eye. A beat -- then he suddenly lunges -- grabbing Irene and p her to the ground. In the same instant Tan Suit appears o the darkness, opening fire with his automatic. Bullets spark as they hit the concrete floor and the othe parked vehicles. Driver drags Irene behind a car now, cov her with his body as Tan Suit fires another burst. More sparks light up the darkness, the bullets penetratin car with ease, narrowly missing Driver and Irene. Driver moves again, dragging the terrified Irene behind h Suit loses sight of them in the darkness, striding past r parked cars. (CONTINUED) 65 9/24/10 107 CONTINUED: (2) 107

Driver turns to Irene as they take cover behind a pillar. looks terrified -- not just of Tan Suit but of him. It's all her worst fears have been confirmed. Driver stares back at her, then hears Tan Suit's footstep approaching. He holds her gaze apologetically, then gets to his feet a runs, trying to draw Tan Suit's fire. Tan Suit hears him and opens up again, more bullets light the darkness. Driver keeps moving. Tan Suit strides after reloading, when suddenly his gun jams. Crouching behind another vehicle, Driver sees this and ta chance, darting out after his pursuer. Tan Suit sees him and runs, the hunter becoming the hunted now. Still lying on the ground, Irene listens to their echoing footsteps. Driver runs after Tan Suit through the darkness, gaining time. Tan Suit looks desperate now, tiring. He turns to f pursuer but Driver's on him in a flash, hurling him again car. Tan Suit slams into the car, losing his balance. Driver g him, swinging him around, smashing him into another car. Irene's watching from the shadows, stunned by the violenc picks herself up and runs towards the elevator. Driver keeps slamming Tan Suit against the car, beating t resistance out of him. As his body begins to slump, Drive him by the throat and rams his head into a car window. The glass splinters with blood, the force of the blow sha Tan Suit's skull. Driver looks around for Irene now and sees her standing i elevator, framed against the light. She stares back at him, but makes no attempt to step out. Driver stands there, his hands covered in Tan Suit's bloo elevator doors finally close, hiding Irene from view. 108 OMITTED 108

108a EXT. LA STREET - NIGHT. 108a Shannon gets out of his car. Driver is waiting for him by own car, silhouetted against the streetlight. Shannon sta him a moment, then notices the blood stains on his shirt. (CONTINUED) 66 9/24/10
108a CONTINUED: 108a SHANNON
What happened? DRIVER
Nino's guys came after me. How did they know about Irene? Shannon takes a moment to reply, looking dazed. SHANNON

I called Bernie...I asked if he could help. Him and Nino are like brothers. I told him you weren't interested in the money, that you only did it for the girl... (From the heart) I wanted to make sure once you returned the money that was the end of it... Driver doesn't seem to hear him. SHANNON
Let me talk to Bernie again. They probably didn't listen to him - DRIVER
It's too late... Shannon says nothing now, knowing he's right. DRIVER
They're gonna come after you to find me. You have to leave... Shannon takes this in slowly. SHANNON
What are you gonna do?... Driver doesn't answer, but from his silence Shannon can g SHANNON
How the fuck did this happen? We're supposed be in Charlotte or Daytona drinking champagne out of trophies and getting laid by pit lizards... He stares at Driver with quiet regret. SHANNON
Bernie Rose looks quietly furious. BERNIE ROSE
...I already gave you my advice. You should have taken your money and left this guy alone. Nino and Cook sit opposite him, both of Cook's hands brok NINO
It's not that simple, Bernie. BERNIE ROSE
Not now that it's bounced up in your face. COOK
Mr. Paolozzi, I owe you this guy. Just give me the okay and I'll - BERNIE ROSE
You like taking orders, go shut the blinds. He looks at Cook's broken hands. BERNIE ROSE
Sun's in my eyes... Nino doesn't look at Cook, a clear indication he should d he's told. Cook stands up, humiliated, and walks over to windows. Bernie Rose waits for Nino to explain. NINO

...The money belonged to a half assed wiseguy from Philly. I had a tip-off he was keeping a million in a pawn shop and was gonna invest it here in LA, try to run a rival operation. I wanted to teach him a lesson... The lights in the restaurant gradually fade as Cook shuts blinds. BERNIE ROSE (INCREDULOUSLY)
You stole from the East Coast mob? NINO
I stole from a jumped up punk who was gonna step on our business - (CONTINUED) 68 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: 110 BERNIE ROSE
And where did this punk find a million dollars? You ever consider he may have consulted some higher-ups? You even bother to check? - NINO
I don't give a fuck who gave him their blessing. This is my city - BERNIE ROSE
Your city? This is a big city, pal, and last time I checked we were partners! - NINO
We are partners - BERNIE ROSE

Then why the fuck didn't you come to me before you set up your dummy robbery or hired this fucking amateur?!... Cook sits back down at the table, having closed the blind looks almost embarrassed for once. NINO
This was off to the side, Bernie. I didn't wanna involve you. BERNIE ROSE
Well, now you fucked up I am involved. Anyone finds out you stole from the family they'll kill both of us - NINO

What family? These fucks still call me a kike to my face. I'm fifty nine years old, they pinch my cheek, treat me like a fuckin' kid. They're the reason we left New York in the first place. Decrepit old men waving us over to their dinner and domino tables to complain. BERNIE ROSE
Those old men gave us the funds to move out here. NINO
And I made them a lotta money. I made you a lotta money too... He stares at Bernie, genuinely indignant now. (CONTINUED) 69 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: (2) 110 NINO
I pay them half of everything I fucking earn and then they set up some fucking kid from Philadelphia just because he's a fucking wop! There's a hint of sympathy in Bernie's eyes. BERNIE ROSE

The money always flows up, Izzy. You know that. He calls Nino by his childhood name now, emphasizing the that they're both outsiders in this organization. For the time Nino's tough guy act slips and he looks anxious. NINO
That's why this driver has to go. Him, and maybe your friend Shannon, are the only two people who can tie me to the robbery. BERNIE ROSE
What about this prick? He doesn't even bother to look at Cook. COOK
Mr. Paolozzi - NINO
Shut up... The two friends stare at each other as if Cook didn't exi BERNIE ROSE
Are you asking my permission? NINO
I'm asking for your help. I shoulda' come to you first, Bernie. I know that. We're a team. He stares at Bernie apologetically, appealing to their friendship. NINO
I'll pay you back the three hundred you spent on the race car. BERNIE ROSE
It's not about the money... He stares out quietly, torn. (CONTINUED) 70 9/24/10 110 CONTINUED: (3) 110 BERNIE ROSE
All right... Nino nods in gratitude. BERNIE ROSE (TO COOK)

Pass the salt... Cook hesitates, thinking Bernie's fucking with him for ha two broken hands. He stares back dumbly and it's the fina straw. Bernie suddenly grabs a stainless steel fork and r in his eye. As Cook screams, Bernie takes a knife and bur in his neck. He twists the knife deeper for good measure, with one powerful sweep of his arm clears Cook off the ta Cook's not dead yet, just writhing on the floor, choking own blood. Bernie Rose keeps his eyes fixed on Nino. BERNIE ROSE

Your turn to clean up after me... 110a EXT. TRAILER/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES - MOR The CREW are setting up for their first shot of the day. background we see a DIRECTOR blocking out an action scene Driver walks past without even a glance, heading towards make-up trailer. He opens the door and walks in, looking the trailer until he finds what he's looking for -- the S he saw previously on the film set.
Shannon limps down the steps from his office with a suitc his hand. He heads into the main garage then suddenly sto Bernie Rose stands beside the stock car, waiting for him. BERNIE ROSE
All these priceless cars, you should get better locks... SHANNON
Door's always open to you... Bernie Rose heads towards him with his hands in his coat pockets. BERNIE ROSE
Going somewhere? SHANNON
Thinking about it. (CONTINUED) 71 9/24/10 111 CONTINUED: 111 BERNIE ROSE
I'm looking for your driver. SHANNON
You break in like this I figure it's bad news. BERNIE ROSE
It's bad luck. Two thousand heists in this city a year, he had to pick the wrong one. SHANNON
He tried to put it right. BERNIE ROSE
Picked the wrong guy for that too. My partner's a belligerent asshole with his back against the wall... He stops, facing Shannon. BERNIE ROSE
Right now so am I. I don't take care of this I'm in big trouble... He stares at his old friend. BERNIE ROSE
Any idea where he is? SHANNON
Probably across the border by now. Mexico. Belize. That's where I'd go... Bernie Rose smiles, not believing a word. BERNIE ROSE
He just walked out on you after everything you've done for him, took all the money? SHANNON
That's gratitude, I guess. Bernie Rose can't help grinning, fond of Shannon despite everything. BERNIE ROSE

I ever tell you how long Izzy and I been friends? Since we were six. Only Jews in a neighborhood of wops. Long as I can remember he was getting me into trouble and I was getting him out of scrapes... He looks almost apologetic. (CONTINUED) 72 9/24/10 111 CONTINUED: (2) 111 BERNIE ROSE
Anyone else I'd take your side... SHANNON
Anyone else I'd do the same... Bernie Rose watches him with a mixture of affection and r BERNIE ROSE
What's this fucking kid to you anyway? Shannon shrugs, no idea himself. BERNIE ROSE
I leave here without finding out where he is, there'll be others coming after me. I guarantee they'll be too stupid to figure out you won't talk and drag this out unnecessarily... SHANNON
Then I'm glad you got here first... Bernie Rose holds his gaze, then looks away, admiring the stock car. BERNIE ROSE
You know, it's too bad, I was getting excited about our race team, having my name all over the car. I think we could have made something of this business... SHANNON

Nah, I'd have fucked it up too... Shannon smiles, reconciled with himself. Bernie Rose grin extends his hand. They shake hands firmly, like old frien when suddenly Shannon recoils, as if he's been stung. We see now that his shirt sleeve is covered in blood, his cut all the way from his elbow to his wrist. He looks daz paralysed with shock. Bernie Rose holds a razor knife in his hand, the blade we Shannon's blood. He takes Shannon gently by the arm and s down against the boot of the stock car. BERNIE ROSE

You won't feel a thing. Close your eyes and you'll fall asleep... Shannon stares out numbly, the life ebbing out of him. Be Rose watches him quietly, wiping his bloody razor with a handkerchief. 73 9/24/10

111a INT. BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 111a Bernie Rose replaces the razor knife in a small lacquered full of other knives. From next door he can hear his neig arguing again. He stands there a moment, deflated, then s storms towards his front door. 111b EXT. CORRIDOR/ BERNIE ROSE'S NEIGHBORS' APARTMENT - A loud knocking. Bernie Rose's neighbor opens his door. HUSBAND
Yeah? BERNIE ROSE
Bernie Rose, next apartment over - HUSBAND
Yeah, I know. I'm kind of busy here. BERNIE ROSE
I heard... There's something threatening in the old mobster's eyes n husband moves to close the door but Bernie jams it open w elbow, shoves him aside, then looks over at the wife. BERNIE ROSE
You all right, Shonda? The woman nods without meeting his eyes. HUSBAND
Get the hell out of my - Bernie doesn't give him time to finish, clamping a powerf on his throat. BERNIE ROSE
What's your fucking name? HUSBAND LENNY - BERNIE ROSE
I'm a patient man, Lenny, not much for getting in other people's way. What I figure is, we've all got our own lives, right? And the right to be left alone? (SQUEEZING HARDER)
So I sit next door for almost a year now listening to what goes down in here and I keep thinking, hey, they'll work it out. You gonna work it out, Lenny? (CONTINUED) 74 9/24/10
111b CONTINUED: 111b He jerks the husband's neck forward, making him nod. BERNIE ROSE

You're lucky to have her, lucky she's put up with you this long. Lucky I've put up with you. She has good reason: she loves you. I don't have any reason at all. So stop raising your voice or fucking move... He lets go of the terrified man and storms out again.

head_text.subj: INT/ EXT. DRIVER'S CAR/ RESEDA BOULEVARD

text: Sunlight glints on the parked vehicles by the curb. Drive down as he approaches the sign for Shannon's Custom Kings glancing out of the window to see if anyone's staking out garage. Satisfied there's no-one there, he drives through

Driver pulls open the garage door and sees the rows of vi cars shimmering in the shafts of sunlight. As he heads pa vehicles he suddenly spots a figure slumped against the s car. Shannon's eyes have been closed, his head resting ge against the trunk of the car. Driver kneels down and lifts him up in his arms, holding a second, then lays him down on the floor. He turns back opens the car boot now, revealing the black gym bag full money.
Driver's car roars out of the garage.

Nino stands in the kitchen, wearing a beautiful suit but shoes or socks, listening on his cell phone. We hold on t curious image for a moment, then reveal a beautifully dre WOMAN polishing his shoes. And now we see more of Nino's also smartly dressed and accompanied by GORGEOUS WOMEN, g ready for an event. Nino's talking to his wife on the pho NINO
Alright honey, I'll pick you up in an hour.

Two big Lincoln Towncars are parked outside. Across the r recognize Driver's car. He opens the trunk. When he close again we see that he's wearing the eerily convincing SFX He crosses the road, entering the pizzeria. 75 9/24/10
Several of Nino's men look up as Driver enters but none o recognize him. NINO'S GUY
We're closed... Driver stares past them at Nino in the kitchen, surrounde more of his men. We feel his mind calculating then he wal again.
Nino emerges with his bodyguards now, heading towards one white Lincolns. NINO

(To one of his men) I'm going to pick up my wife. I'll meet you there... Across the road Driver climbs into his car, still wearing mask. He starts his car, setting off after Nino's Lincoln 119 INT. DRIVER'S CAR/ NINO'S PIZZERIA/ WESTWOOD - NIGHT. Driver drifts in behind a couple of other cars, keeping t between himself and the Lincoln.
The sunlight is fading fast. The neon cityscape has come and the streets are a sea of glittering lights.
The CHAUFFEUR checks his mirror as he turns into another seeing only the anonymous glare of headlights behind him.
Driver slows down and lets another car turn in front of h keeping it between himself and Nino's car.
The streets are less crowded in this residential area. As car in front of Driver pulls into its front drive, Driver the next turning, making sure the Lincoln doesn't spot hi 76 9/24/10
Driver cruises along another residential street. At every intersection we glimpse the Lincoln heading in the same direction down a parallel street.
The Lincoln turns back into traffic on San Vincente.
Nino's talking on a cell phone in the back seat. NINO
...Sure, Carlo, I'll send him your regards...
Driver merges in with the traffic, weaving between the ca front of him until he has Nino's Lincoln back in his sigh
The sun has almost set, the red backlights of the cars bl in the fading light.

Nino's car turns into 7th Street. 130 INT. DRIVER'S CAR/ SAN VINCENTE/ 7TH STREET - NIGHT. This time there are no other vehicles turning into the sa street. Driver has no choice, settling in behind the Linc
The chauffeur glances in his rear-view mirror and spots D car for the first time. For now he doesn't give it much t In the back seat Nino finally says goodbye on the phone. NINO
...Nice talking to you too... (As he hangs up) Asshole...
Both cars head into Entrada Drive. 77 9/24/10

location: NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES

text: The chauffeur checks his mirror again and notices Driver' still on his tail. Just as a precaution he slows down, se the pursuing car will overtake.
Driver has to decide in an instant whether to take up the invitation. He overtakes the Lincoln, speeding ahead.

location: NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES

text: Nino's chauffeur sees Driver's car disappear up ahead, re now.

location: DRIVER'S CAR/ WEST CHANNEL ROAD/ PCH

text: Driver puts his foot on the gas, taking sharp turns on sm side streets, driving fast around the block until he's ba the Lincoln's tail, keeping a safe distance now.
Nino's chauffeur turns right into the Pacific Coast Highw
Driver follows the Lincoln at a distance, keeping the win corners of the PCH between himself and his prey.
From above we see Driver's car gliding along the open hig the rising hills on one side, the churning ocean on the o no vehicles in sight.
In the back seat Nino dials another number on his cell-ph NINO
...Bernie, it's me...
The headlights of Driver's car sweep ahead of it on the o road. From above it looks like a shark closing in on its
Bernie Rose stands by the window, listening to the phone silence. 78 9/24/10
Nino sounds apologetic. NINO
...Look, about that thing today...I'm sorry. I know how much you liked the guy... In his rear view mirror the chauffeur sees the headlights car behind getting closer.
Driver stares ahead, his eyes fixed on the Lincoln's back
Bernie Rose doesn't speak, looking weary.
Bernie?... BERNIE ROSE
Yeah?...
You're the only fucking person in the world I trust. I love you, man... Bernie shakes his head, the same old apologies.
In the front seat Nino's chauffeur checks his mirror curi NINO
When this is over I'll make it up to you, I swear... The lights of the car behind have vanished.
Even from above we can't see Driver's car with its lights no idea how close it is to Nino's car.
Even though he's still angry, Bernie can't help forgiving childhood friend. BERNIE ROSE
How many times I heard that before... 79 9/24/10
Nino grins. NINO
I lost count - Suddenly blazing headlights explode to life behind him.
Driver rams the Lincoln at over a hundred miles an hour, it just above the left rear wheel.
The impact is momentous. The huge Continental is lifted u the air and spun round at the same time. It slams back in tarmac then flips end over end for a hundred yards.
Bernie Rose is left holding the phone as the line goes de
The collision has barely knocked Driver off course. His c skids to a stop near the overturned wreck.
Among the carnage, we see Nino, bloodied but still alive. unbuckles his seat belt and crawls out of the twisted wre

Driver gets out of his car, calmly walking over to the pulverized Lincoln. He sees Nino stumbling off towards th but doesn't hurry after him yet. He checks to make sure t other passengers are dead, then heads on.

Nino stumbles through the sand, running for his life now. looks behind him and sees Driver calmly pursuing him. He running, but he's badly injured, slowing all the time. Fe clouds reason and he staggers towards the crashing waves. Driver slows down as he watches the gangster wade into th ocean, a pathetic last attempt to evade him. The crashing and the undertow are an impenetrable wall. Every time Nin to wade out further, the ocean drags him back. (CONTINUED) 80 9/24/10 156 CONTINUED: 156

Driver stares at his trapped prey. Nino's attempts become and more feeble as the ocean exhausts him and snuffs out hope of escape. Finally he retreats back into the shallow barely able to keep his footing. He turns around and face Driver, the crashing waves still smashing into his back. They stay like that for a moment. Gazing at each other. D silhouetted against the white sand. Nino trapped in the o Then Driver wades out into the water. Nino has no fight l him, staring at the masked man. Driver stares back at him grabs him by the throat, forcing his head under the water splutters as Driver lets him up again. NINO
It was Bernie...Bernie Rose killed your friend not me... Driver shoves his face back under the water, keeping it t until Nino's body finally stops thrashing.
A phone shrills. Bernie Rose answers it. BERNIE ROSE
Nino?
He's dead. Bernie Rose stares out in silence. Whatever he thinks of part of him has died. We feel the regret in his eyes but no trace of emotion in his voice. BERNIE ROSE
Looks like me, you and your girlfriend are the only pieces left on the board...
Driver is no longer wearing a mask, framed against the oc catches the veiled threat in Bernie's words but doesn't r INTERCUT BERNIE ROSE
I'd say this has gone far enough. See any reason why it should go on?... DRIVER
Doesn't have to... (CONTINUED) 81 9/24/10 158 CONTINUED: 158 BERNIE ROSE
Then we should talk. You know a place called the Great Wall -- out on Sherman Way?
I can find it. Bernie pauses, staring out.
I'll see you there at one. A charged silence, then the line goes dead. 159 OMITTED 159

A large Chinese restaurant. We follow Driver through the He sees Bernie Rose sitting at a table on his own, pourin himself a glass of wine. The mobster's dressed for the oc wearing a jacket and tie. He smiles at Driver as he sits BERNIE ROSE
Care for a glass?... Driver doesn't smile, gazing back at him across the table Bernie Rose doesn't seem to care. BERNIE ROSE

I can recommend the duck. Hell, I can recommend everything -- Walnut prawns, shredded beef, Velvet chicken -- but the duck's to die for... He delivers the last line with a pointed smile, then turn calling over a WAITRESS. BERNIE ROSE
The duck, please. For two. WAITRESS
Anything else? BERNIE ROSE
No, thanks... He waits for the waitress to leave, then turns back to Dr BERNIE ROSE
You've been on a roll. Cut yourself quite a swath out there. (CONTINUED) 82 9/24/10 160 CONTINUED: 160 DRIVER
I never asked for any of it. BERNIE ROSE
We usually don't. But it comes down on our heads regardless. Look at Shannon... Driver holds his gaze, the tension palpable, laughter and conversation drifting over from the other tables. BERNIE ROSE
Anyway it's water under the bridge now. Question is where does that leave us? DRIVER
That's up to you. BERNIE ROSE
You bring the cash? Driver nods. Bernie Rose studies him quietly. BERNIE ROSE

Tell me something, how does someone with no interest in money get mixed up in a heist? (Off his silence) Shannon told me it was because of the girl? Driver hesitates, betraying a hint of concern. Bernie see and smiles. BERNIE ROSE
Don't worry. Nobody else knows about her. Just me... (A BEAT)
You still see her?... DRIVER
She's not interested. BERNIE ROSE

She's got her head screwed on right. I got two ex-wives, three kids, four grandchildren. Not one of them speaks to me now... He smiles again, looking into Driver's eyes with just a h sympathy. BERNIE ROSE
This is what I'll do for you. You give me the money, nobody knows she exists. But it's a different matter with you. (MORE) (CONTINUED) 83 9/24/10 160 CONTINUED: (2) 160
BERNIE ROSE (cont'd) These people I have the misfortune to be involved with, they don't mind Nino being gone, but they'll wanna know what happened to him... DRIVER
Sounds like we have a problem... BERNIE ROSE
And just when we were getting to know each other... Their eyes are fixed on each other, deadly enemies but ki spirits of a kind. BERNIE ROSE

...We shake hands, say goodbye, it's the start of your new life. Sooner or later they'll come after you. No end to it. Someone gets tired, somebody else takes their place. It goes on and on. Whatever dreams you have, whatever plans, you might as well forget `em, because this is what it's gonna be like till the day you die... (A BEAT)
I just thought you should know... Driver stares back at him quietly. DRIVER
What do you suggest I do? BERNIE ROSE
First time I heard about you, Shannon told me you drove. Fast. That's a start... He keeps staring at Driver, then smiles. BERNIE ROSE
Either that or you choke on the duck...

Driver's car is parked at the back of the parking lot, ha hidden by a fenced area for garbage. Driver pops the trun taking out the black gym bag with the cash. Bernie Rose d even look at it, still admiring the car. BERNIE ROSE
How much does something like this cost? DRIVER
Nine, ten thousand. If you can find one that still runs. (CONTINUED) 84 9/24/10 161 CONTINUED: 161 BERNIE ROSE
Maybe I'll take yours. Part of our deal. He grins, then holds out his hand for the gym bag. BERNIE ROSE

Guess we won't be seeing each other again.. Driver reaches out to give him the bag, when suddenly Ber hand snakes out of his pocket, twisting a switch-blade in Driver's gut. He pulls it out, ready to stab again, but t time Driver catches his wrist, slowly forcing the knife u his throat. Their eyes are fixed on each other for a moment, with som like regret, then the blade pierces Bernie Rose's neck, s deeper and deeper. Driver holds the old man in his arms a dies. They stay like that, locked in a fatal embrace, the Driver lowers Bernie Rose gently to the ground, out of si Blood seeping through his shirt, Driver picks up the gym puts it back in the trunk, slamming the door shut.
We're looking down on an enormous parking lot, hundreds o different colored vehicles gleaming down below. Driver pu into the lot, searching for a place to park.

Driver climbs out of his car, wearing a jacket over his b soaked shirt. He walks to the back of the car, kneels dow hides the keys behind the left rear wheel, drops of blood dripping on the tarmac beneath him. He gets up again, the off through the maze of parked vehicles, dialling a numbe his cell-phone.
Irene and Benicio sit in the park. IRENE
(Picking up her phone) Hello?... (INTERCUT)
The blazing sun beats down. Driver walks through a long c of glinting cars. DRIVER
It's me... (CONTINUED) 85 9/24/10 164 CONTINUED: 164
Irene stares in surprise.
Don't hang up... She says nothing but stays on the line. Driver continues painfully through the maze of cars. DRIVER

You got a pen? I need you to write something down... Irene looks confused as she hears the quiet urgency in hi voice, then reaches inside her handbag. Sunlight glitters on the roofs of the parked cars, dazzli Driver's eyes. DRIVER
DRIVER
It's the license number for my car. I've left it in a parking lot on the corner of Culver and Lincoln. Section M 10... Irene writes down the details, looking even more confused
There's a bag in the trunk with some money. Keys are under the left rear wheel... IRENE
What do you want me to do with it?... Driver walks with difficulty, finding it hard to breathe. DRIVER
It's yours. It's safe to keep it... All around him the Chevys, Dodges, and Fords glitter in t sunlight. IRENE

I told you, I don't need your money... Blood seeps through Driver's shirt, dripping on the tarma Irene hears his labored breathing now, looking concerned. (CONTINUED) 86 9/24/10 164 CONTINUED: (2) 164 IRENE
Are you okay?... Driver's skin looks deathly pale, his eyes a haunting sha blue. He keeps walking through the maze of cars, casting eyes from one vehicle to the next, looking for the perfec DRIVER
Just out of breath... Finally he spots a beautiful white Camaro up ahead. DRIVER
How're you doing?... For the first time we see the Echo Park fountain sparklin the background. IRENE
Fine. I'm in the park with Benicio... Irene can no longer hold back her tears, heartbroken. Driver stops in front of the white Camaro, unsteady on hi DRIVER
I gotta go Irene... He pauses. DRIVER
Meeting you was the best thing that ever happened to me... Irene smiles sadly. IRENE
It was nice to meet you too...
From above we see the maze of vehicles stretching out for Chevys, Chryslers, Fords -- the history of America on whe Driver switches off his cell-phone reluctantly then heads towards the Camaro.

Driver climbs into the front seat of the Camaro, catching breath. He sits there a moment, sheltering from the world outside, then pulls out a pocket knife, opening the blade he finds the screwdriver. He starts with the left side of steering column, then gets to work on the section below t signal. (CONTINUED) 87 9/24/10 166 CONTINUED: 166
His face shows the strain, but his fingers are as steady ever. A master at work. Finally he breaks into the igniti device, leaning back in the seat to take a rest.
We're gazing down at the white Camaro from above, waiting to move.
Driver's face is completely still now. So are his eyes. H almost at peace. There's a long pause, then slowly he lea forward and turns on the ignition. As the engine comes to we CUT TO BLACK.
